Title: Not a 5 star hotel!
Text:
This should not be a 5 star hotel!  Great restaurant & nice looking property, but 80% of the attention is given to the restaurant and not the hotel.  EXAMPLES: 
1- They offer room service (as expected at any 5 star hotel) but frequently tell you the kitchen staff is too busy with the restaurant to be able to provide room service.  So there really is no reliable room service. 
2- One arrives at the hotel and there is no one to help you with your luggage! 
3- Front desk staff and reception staff members are clueless regarding what great service means.

Title: Nice hotel, not 5* to me
Text: Generally a very nice hotel. Especially the bathtub area was great. It is in a residential area, very safe. It is a small hotel, only 15 rooms,  The entire staff was very friendly. The main general criticism was that it seemed to be a restaurant first, hotel 2nd. Also, the only dinner restaurant was a prix-fix menu, more than $300 per person. Would expect more choices. The specific criticism: I asked front desk if there was English speaking news channel on TV.   Now, we generally go to bed early. The gentleman at the front desk offered to come to our room to set it up. It was about 9:30 pm and my wife was in bed already. After 15 to 20 minutes, he couldn't figure out how to get any channel, English or Spanish, on the tv. He said he was sending someone else up, and about 15 minutes later, a woman came up. After about 10 minutes, she called someone else who came up about 10 minutes later, and got the TV channels on after about 15 minutes. They immediately left, with a Spanish speaking station on. We scrolled through about 70 to 80 channels, and while there were two or three channels playing movies in English, we found no news stations.

Title: Hidden gem behind the wall
Text:
This hotel is quite amazing. We were only able to spend one night here but it was a fantastic experience.
It is an ultra modern hotel with superb fixtures and fittings. It was all so very comfortable. The suite was huge and a further huge outdoor terrace.
It is in a lovely area of Barcelona . The excellent breakfast was served on a delightful terrace. The staff were very welcoming and helpful. A thoroughly first class, 5 star experience.

Title: Great hotel
Text:
Beautiful hotel with great staff.
The experience is amazing already from the  moment you walk in the lobby.
the staff is friendly and professional.
The lobby is beautiful.
The room is just amazing.
I love the breakfast and i love the restaurant abac

Title: Superb expÃ©rience
Text:
Thanks to a family event and also the Formula 1 Grand Prix of Barcelona , we decided to stay at ABaC with my wife and our two sons .

Located in a very quiet  and charming area of Barcelona, this â€œBoutique hotel â€œis very elegant.

And letâ€™s start by mentioning how much the staff is extremely kind, professional,efficient with a lot of empathy for guests.

From the moment you arrive at the hotel,you feel privileged and cared..
We selected Deluxe rooms, very wide, well-equipped, with a modern design.All details are really very well anticipated.â€¦
The Spa is very elegant ,and we experienced very good relaxing massages.

We previously booked the dinner at the 3 Stars Michelin restaurant of the hotel.
A fantastic epicurean experience,with surprising mixed flavors, a deep attention to cooking,and the use of unique local ingredients.

So everything was fabulous and far beyond our most optimistic expectations !

It took me time to find out some points to improve and really thinking about it I would just mention that the restaurant should adopt a dress code policy for guests.

Even if the key point is what you discover in your plates ,which in this case was really unbelievable, having dinner with some ( only some ) other tables where people come in blue jeans,sneakers, Â«Â HawaiianÂ Â» short sleeves style shirts is not what I expect in a 3 stars hotels.

Usually at this level, Business casual, or jackets are requiredâ€¦Iâ€™m not stating that suits and ties should be mandatory , but there should be a minimum ,specified in advance to guestsâ€¦If there is not a minimum of respect for the other guests and employees, what can we expect in the future? People coming to dinner in Bermudaâ€™s?

Once again, it took me a lot of efforts to highlight a point of improvement but I believe that this should be considered by the restaurant owners â€¦

If you have the chance to visit this fantastic city of Barcelona, DO NOT miss the opportunity to stay at ABaC, enjoy the dinner and â€¦relax..

We will do our best to be back again and againâ€¦.

P.S: quite sad to have seen Charles Leclerc stopped while leading a  fantastic race on the Ferrari ,because of an unexpected engine failureâ€¦.But He will be back stronger ! ðŸ’ª

Title: Good times at ABaC Hotel
Text:
We can definitely recommend this hotel. The Deluxe room ist really nice, thereâ€˜s enough space, has a samsung speaker, smart tv, a shower, a bathtubâ€¦ We also really liked Irene from the reception, she showed us the hotel and gave all the necessery information.
Spa is small but nice. The gym was somewhat disappointing though.

Title: A VERY special place
Text: Our reception was efficient and welcoming. The room and the spa facilities are superb.  There is excellent attention to detail. Covid precautions were properly adhered to and public areas were exceptionally clean.  The  patio restaurant had limited options and the staff there less attentive than elsewhere in the hotel.  Parking facilities were also very welcome as there is no easily accessible parking nearby.

Title: A beautiful stay
Text:
Super happy with the hotel. Staff were very friendly and accommodating. They were great with organising tickets to attractions in Barcelona and recommending some sights that are not the usual tourist traps. 

Nice and quiet rooms and far enough from the hustle and bustle. 

On the first night we did have a slight issue with the airconditioning, however on notifying them the following morning the issue was promptly remedied. 

Bed was very comfortable, rooms well appointed. Clean and tidy every day. 

Would like to thank the staff for making out Christmas stay a memorable one. 

Just a note... please be sure to make a booking at the ABaC restaurant 10/10.

Thank you.

Title: Tough review to write: Great hotel, but "accessible" room isn't.
Text:
This might be the hardest review I've ever written. So much about this place is fantastic. Warm, welcoming staff; interesting hotel in good location; included breakfast is not to be missed. (We chose the hotel because we were having dinner at the restaurant, which I'll review separately, but in short the restaurant really is as fantastic as advertised.) An easy 5/5 if you don't need an accessible room... but I did.

It's a trek, but you can get to the room from the lobby in a wheelchair. Inside the (admittedly quite lovely room) my very undersized wheelchair could get to most places but not others. There was zero chance at showering while seated. (They brought a stool, but the shower door opens the wrong way so there's no way to transfer.) So i had to wash up at the sink after a transatlantic flight, before and after a stunning meal, and in the morning.

I'll stay here again if I don't need my wheelchair by next year, but otherwise, the false advertising of an accessible room is an absolute crusher. Disabled traveler, beware.

Title: Service is more than perfect, Hotel is beautiful, perfectly located
Text:
After being in Barcelona for several times, staying at ABaC hotel was by far the best hotel experience I've ever had in the city.
The Hotel is perfectly connected with the city centre. The metro stops right in front of the hotel and with a max 10 mins ride and only 5 stops you can get to Gracia and plaza Catalunya.
The rooms are much more spatious compared to 5* hotels in Barcelona and the ABaC hotel has a nice little garden surrounded by trees which gives to every room a very relaxing view.  
The interior design is very accurate and modern, favouring a very comfortable stay also for longer periods. Also bathrooms are designed to be relaxing but at the same time very practical.
The rooms are equipped with coffee machine, tea boiler, sat TV with all the main channels in every language and a bluetooth loudspeaker for listening to music.
The staff speaks very well all the main european languages and is always ready to help with any need that a guest might have (from revervation in restaurants, to extra services). Furthermore, the room is always in perfect conditions thanks to the perfect job done by cleaners. You don't see them around and the cleaning service never bothers, but they are always present, morning, day and eve (turndown service)
Special mention goes to the really delightful breakfast with premium ingredients and perfect service thanks to very experienced and empathetic personnel.

Title: Nice hotel, fabulous restaurant, needs a little maintenance for the prices
Text:
I really wanted to rate this 5, but some nagging details prevented me from doing so. Thatâ€™s a shame because it is a very nice place and certainly expensive enough. 

Our penthouse room was spacious and provided an outstanding roof top terrace to enjoy breakfast or wine at the end of the day. Staff was super helpful, friendly and tried very hard to please. Check in takes a bit of time if you arrive at the same time as others.  The restaurant on site was a fabulous experience - reviewed separately. 

What we continued to notice were the little things. The faucet handles were loose on the bathroom sink. One door handle to the roof terrace was falling apart, no instructions for the complicated lighting system (which we figured out after a day), worn furniture and scuffed floors, and a confusing terrace door system that allows the top of the doors to fall partially into the room. This last item surprised the crap out of us as we thought it was falling out of the frame onto us. More instruction at check in or written placards would have made some of these moot points. If these details had been attended to, this would have been a solid 5 rating. 

The neighborhood is quiet so if you want a nice place out of the city with a master culinary restaurant on site, this is the place. Cheers

Title: Amazing
Text: Amazing hotel, so beautiful and so friendly staff. They will take care of you like a king and queen. Really nice spa and all the services you can think of. The restaurant is fantastic and to visit this place is a must.

Title: Fantastic
Text: Stayed in here at the start of they year for a week and the place was just wow. Food was amazing same with staff. Really comfy beds. Near a tube so you could get about the city no problem. Beautiful city, would highly advice to stay here.

Title: Fantastico Hotel in the Fantastico City of Barcelona
Text:
Our  stay was a fabulous experience, from Roberto's assistance via e-mail before we arrived to the kind attentions of elegant Maite and others at the front desk and in the breakfast room.  The property is serene inside and out, with many areas to lounge in the sun or shaded gardens and staff who go out of their way to see to your every need.  Our spacious, sunny room (with 5 or 6 huge, breezy windows) was in a section of the building which necessitated us to walk through the 3 Star ABaC Restaurant kitchens, as we came and left.  It was like a brief glimpse of greatness and fun to see the chefs doing their quiet, precise choreography, as we passed through the gleaming kitchens.  (The hotel is designed this way on purpose, with the intent of making the guests feel "at home" and part of the family.)  
   Our room was spacious, with high ceilings and many, many tall windows and bright and/or serene lighting, with many control switches at convenient locations.  The air conditioning was perfect, quiet and easy to control and very precise.  The beds were like sleeping on a fluffy cloud, with feather-light duvets and pillows of the gods.   An alcove was created by three large windows jutting out from the room, which had a wall to wall lounge sofa (about 9 feet long) filling the space and topped with many pillows.  The views were of the leafy grounds and gardens up to the estates at the top of the Tibidabo mountain in the distance.   The rooms have the latest flat screen television, blue tooth speakers, remote controlled drapes and shades, nespresso machines and refrigerator.   The luxurious bath has a glass shower with rain showerhead, a gigantic jetted tub with mood lights and separate toilet and bidet room.  The towels and Bulgari toiletries add to the pampering.  Drapes create a private dressing room, with two enormous, lighted closets and many useful drawers and luggage counters.  Two hints: It took us many days to realize that we could change the language on the tv to English, by hitting the icon of the global world on the keyboard, so that we could search, etc.   The electronic key works with ease on all the gates and doors.  What a pleasure and a contrast to the electronic keys in the USA, which seem to loss their viability after a few hours in your pocket.   
 The Spa area was glamorous yet relaxing, with every possible facility from pool to sauna, steam room and sauna was available. 
Forgot to mention: Breakfast was in a lovely library-like room with the most outstanding croissants ever!  A variety of cereals and egg dishes are offered, as well as a variety of meat.  Ask for the Iberian ham sandwich.  Fabulous!  And the juice and fruit which is served is absolutely perfect everyday.  Also, you can arrive for breakfast up to 11 a.m.   Talk about civilized!  I loved this place.
I believe wheelchair access would be easy from the garage, but you need to check.  Also, the beds are very high, which could be an issue.  Entrances are softly lighted (would not have been bright enough for my Mom with glaucoma issues) and the pathway is large squares of pavers,  separated by a two inch border of velvet cut grass.  It is lovely and  attractive, but someone with vision issues, may want assistance.  

 Barcelona is an exquisite and intriguing city and I hope to be able to return for another visit, but only if I can book my stay at the ABaC Hotel.  Gracias por una visita maravillosa!

Title: Fabulous, well-priced, small luxury hotel
Text: Loved this wonderful small luxury hotel that was a 12 minute metro ride to the heart of Barcelona. We started each day with a gourmet breakfast (included with our room) overlooking the hotel's private garden. Then we literally walked across the street to catch the metro for our day's adventure. Upon our return, we went to the spa to be massaged by jets of water in the Jacuzzi and relaxed in the wet/dry saunas. While the hotel boasts a Michelin 3 star restaurant, we were not able to take advantage of it. We loved being pampered by the staff in this artfully, decorated hotel in a local neighborhood.

Title: Very tasteful
Text:
Recently we stayed a couple of nights in the Abac. We have stayed here before, and again it was a most pleasant stay. The rooms are large and very stylish, one of the most tasteful I have ever stayed in. Great bathrooms. We feel at home. Excellent housekeeping: the rooms are always tidy and in order but you never see them work. Friendly and helpful staff overall. Location is nice: outside of the centre's business but close enough and with a metro (L7, Tibidabo) right in front of the hotel (only 8 minutes to Placa Catalunya).

Room for improvement? I do have a few suggestions. The area at -1 is not balanced in my view. The lounge is not frequently used as far as I can see but covers quite some space, whilst the gym is really to small and poorly equipped to actually work out. The pool is small and may in fact be used by 2 persons at the time if you want to swim seriously. Ventilation may be improved. Then again, we never saw anybody at the pool and our kids enjoyed so it wasn't really an issue. Staff is friendly to our kids, but there are not many kids around. In my opinion this hotel is less suited for small children (< 3 years).

Breakfast offers a small supply, but is of high quality. The quality of service is dependent on the lady that is in charge that day. Let's say there is difference between the efficiency of staff. But also here: friendly staff.

Abac is obviously not cheap, but for the high quality it offers I would say it is not expensive either. We had a very pleasant stay and certainly hope to return some day!

Title: Luxury that is well priced
Text: Its a gorgeous smaller hotel, right in the Sarria-Sant Gervasi that we really liked.Â From the start, reception staff were warm and inviting, and very quick, and we were given an upgrade, thanks!Â Excellent location and facilities and service, made good use of the minibar in our room, the room was just gorgeous, all beige, pastels, very bright and inviting. Overall, total luxury at an affordable price.

Title: Abac Restaurant: an out of this world experience
Text: For her birthday, I invited my girlfriend there...but it was also a gift for me :-) The experience is not limited to sit at the table and being served. You get to begin your journey in the kitchen and see where the magic gets done. And then, you go from surprise to surprise. I suggest the wine pairing for an augmented experience. We got wines from 1970 and tried also a Jerez 2 palmas. Of course it comes with a price, but once in a lifetime it totally worth it because we are not going to forget it. The service was excellent and we appreciated discussing with the people serving the delights. It is not stilted but rather cool and we had some good laugh and that is also very appreciable. All in all, an unforgettable experience full of incredible and rich tastes. We weren't hosted at the hotel.

Title: a delight
Text:
We have chosen the Hotel because we wanted to dine in their Restaurant. ( see sep. review) and also we wanted not to be directly in the centre but with a good connection to it.
The Hotel has a good connection to a sub-way station as well as to bus stops incl. the hop on-hop off. It is not in the city centre but in a great small area with some Restaurants, Bars and Cafes and easy to get to the centre.
Also a little park is just beside the Hotel and our room, No. 821, did have a view towards it. The room was spacious and had a large bathroom with sep. shower.
The breakfast was included and the value for money was great. Just one small issue in regards to breakfast, the service was slow.
We would stay there again.

Title: Almost Perfect
Text:
I got the gourmet package for a night in this fabulous hotel. The service was excellent, room was fantastic, and the food at AbaC was amazing. I recommend doing a massage in their spa, it is a great way to relax and chill out before the long dinner.

The only issue I had with my room was late night noise from some kitchen maintenance downstairs. This needs to be addressed, otherwise, it was almost perfect.

Title: Private atmosphere, world-class restaurant, needs some repairs for a perfect score.
Text:
I always choose this hotel when I visit Barcelona. It is a luxury boutique hotel, offering a three-Michelin star restaurant which alone is worth the travel.

The hotel is enclosed in a private property only accessible for guests, which allows for a private, exclusive feeling.

Rooms are modern and bright. The penthouse is nice, featuring a very spacious outdoor terrace with a private whirlpool which makes a bit of a worn impression though.

The location within the city is rather noisy, which you do not hear within your room, though, but on the terrace. I therefore prefer the suites which are more spacious inside and also seem lees "used" than the penthouse. The furniture in some rooms really needs to be replaced.

One tricky issue: the LED lighting in the rooms sometimes leads to cracking noises, probably due to the heat-related expansion of some materials, so if you're sensitive to that, don't worry, it will stop some minutes after the lights were switched off and have cooled down.

Water pressure in the shower of the penthouse was annoyingly low.

Expect for some these minor flaws, I'll surely return.

Title: Nice hotel
Text: Friendly staff, efficient check in and great service at breakfast.Nice large room, comfy bed so a good night's sleep.my family enjoyed lot service they provide is very good and behavior of staff is so good.

Title: Luxurious and relaxing
Text:
We stayed at the hotel as we were eating at the restaurant that night. We booked the gourmet package and stayed in the 'penthouse' as we got a good deal. The penthouse was basically the top floor of the building, accessible by a lift, with a large terrace outside with a table where we ate a wonderful breakfast and a jacuzzi, which although the bubbles weren't working (there were lots of gifts to apologize) it was still hot and relaxing to sit in.

The room was very modern, and with the most amazingly comfortable bed, and a huge curved TV with lots of channels and netflix all enabled. There was also a jacuzzi bath and large bathroom area. Of course, it also had an amazing view from both inside the room and all parts of the terrace. It's in a quiet part of Barcelona too, you could hear the traffic from outside, but it was actually soothing.

We also had use of the hotel Spa, and at 9am, after our breakfast, we had it to ourselves. There was a jacuzzi pool, a steam room, a sauna and an ice cold pool which even I couldn't stay in for long. So relaxing and top quality luxury. 

Of course it wasn't cheap, but for a special night, to go with our amazing meal, it couldn't be beaten.

Title: A Foodie Dream Hotel
Text: I loved staying at the hotel at ABaC.  I bought the food lovers package, not worded that way, but basically that is what it is.  The hotel staff was very nice and pleasant. I was assuming it may be a little snooty being a 3 Star Michelin restaurant.  Not the case at all.  They gave me a â€œhandyâ€ phone which is local cell phone so I could walk around the city and be connected. The best thing about it was no extra charge to use. To get to my room I had to walk through the kitchen to get to the room. I felt like I was in the center of the action.  I got the room with the big balcony.  I went to the spa and then laid out on the chases on my private HUGE patio.  The dining experience was everything I hoped it to be. The wait staff where very informative but also had a sense of humor. I would recommend staying here. It is about 7-11â‚¬ cab ride to the center of downtown. Honesty, it was nice to be staying on the outskirts of chaos.

Title: A Hidden Gem with a 3*** Michelin Restaurant, Perfect for a Romantic Getaway
Text:
My husband and I stayed for 2 nights in Abac as part of their Gourmet experience package.  Itâ€™s a boutique hotel tucked away in a posh residential area in Barcelona, about 10 minutes cab ride from the city center.  The hotel is a converted property from an old embassy with a 3 michelin stars restaurant and a little gym, spa and indoor pool.

The first night we were staying in the Superior Room. The room itself is on the â€œsmallerâ€ scale BUT it has its own private outdoor patio that wrapped around the corner, which is a super plus to us.  You can easily sunbath here in the sun with a view of the park behind (so rather peaceful) - with partial leafy shade roof.  We eat our gourmet breakfast at the table on the private terrace.  You get to choose items from a menu, be sure to choose as many as youâ€™d like.  The slow cooked eggs is by far, the best breakfast eggs we ever have had, period - definitely worth a revisit just for the egg itself.  I would say this is the best value room for the hotel.

The second night, we stayed in the Penthouse, which I believe it to be one of the best rooms in a city hotel.  You get the lift up to your room, which you have to yourself for the entire floor.  The room is big, spacious and modern.  But the real icing is in its terrace - itâ€™s massive.  There are 3 proper â€œcornerâ€ spaces to lounge, sit, eat, drink and a private hot tub.  We even have 2 of our friends who live in the area came to enjoy a bottle of champagne with us in the evening.  Another noteworthy mentioning is from the penthouse lift, you can go down to the spa/gym/pool directly.  While we were there, we have never met any other guests in the entire stay even though the hotel was full.  It feels more like staying in your own â€œluxuryâ€ house in Barcelona than a hotel.  We had a 22-courses tasting menu at the restaurant and it was excellent.   You also get to go through Abac restaurant kitchen, every time you go from reception to lift (should you choose to - there is another private entrance should you rather be discreet).  

We will definitely revisit the hotel.

Title: Fantastic hotel
Text: The ABaC is a quiet, charming luxury hotel located in the heart of Barcelona.  The staff was wonderful, the room was large and extremely well equipped, the restaurant looks incredible (though sadly I did not have time to eat there), and the grounds are immaculate.  I can't wait to return.

Title: Beautiful and not to be missed
Text: This place was a real gem - the staff are fantastic, the rooms are stunning with automatic blinds, crazy comfy beds, a lush spa area, a stunning terrace and a fab restaurant! Canâ€™t fault it!!! We spent our honeymoon here

Title: Amazing value for money
Text:
We stayed for three nights in a suite and had the dining package including 3star abac and 1star angel. 

The suite was beautiful, the 30 courses of food over two nights was incredible 

We cannot get over how inexpensive it all was - even the wine flight each night was reasonably priced

Whilst the hotel is really a taxi Into the ramblas and active part of the city - budget â‚¬40 a day for that, it was incredible. 

We normally stay at hotel arts but never again 

Congratulations.

Title: Very unique and nice!
Text: Forgot to review ABAC last year. My wife and I stayed there for 5 nights and truly loved the place. It is a unique hotel experience. Very private and away from the hustle and bustle of Barcelona. We would be thrilled to stay with them again. Wish we had booked a room with a balcony. Regardless our room was fantastic.

Title: Perfect!
Text:
Such an amazing hotel. The best hotel we have ever stayed in. As soon as we got there the staff were extremely friendly in getting us settled in to our rooms. We had a tour around the hotel were we got to also see the spa area. Such lovely and modern rooms, it almost has a futuristic vibe to it with the glass elevator and open views. 

Also located in a lovely area, quite a lot of restaurants near by and the metro just outside. The beds were unbelievably comfy if we didn't have so much to do in the city we would have loved to have just stayed in the room all day and enjoyed the rooms comforts. The television was a massive added bonus absolutely huge! Amazing! The bathroom was beautiful a rainfall shower in the centre and a jet tub. Lovely added extras like chocolates on the pillows once we got back to the room. 

Wish we didn't have to leave! Can definately say we will be returning soon!

Title: Small Luxury Hotel
Text:
This is a small (only 15 rooms) modern hotel in a good location. Originally it was a private residence and therefore doesn't flow like hotel should, I suppose you could call it quirky!
Our suite was large, very comfortable and spotlessly clean with a lovely bathroom.
The pool and spa was very pleasant for a small hotel.
There was an underground car park which was very handy as it would have been very difficult to park nearby.

Unfortunately we found the staff to be rather surly, a little bit like they were doing you a favour!

We stayed four nights and on one of the nights we dined in the ABaC's 2 Michelin Star Restaurant (now 3 star) and had the 18 course tasting menu. 
The meal was very good but unfortunately the restaurant lacked atmosphere due to other guests spending most of the evening starring at their iPhones! 
Again the staff didn't smile and came across rather cold!

We arrived the day after the Catalan regional election and the following day Barcelona was on strike, so perhaps this may have an impact on the staff.

Title: Luxury hotel lacks 5 star service
Text: This is a beautiful boutique hotel situated in Tibidabo at the end of one of the Metro lines. Although looking tired in places (chipped paint, etc), the room was spacious and very comfortable with a large bathroom with whirlpool bath and separate shower. The hotel has just 15 rooms which is both a strength and a weakness. On the down side, when ringing for room service, it could take several minutes for the â€˜phone to be answered. At breakfast, there was only ever one member of staff on duty. Coping with one or two tables was no problem but, when other guests arrived, the level of service decreased and it took a long time to be served. Surely it should be possible for a hotel of this quality to provide additional members of staff when required. Although this is, in so many ways, a wonderful hotel, weâ€™ll probably look to stay elsewhere next time weâ€™re in Barcelona.

Title: Beautiful and Quiet Hotel
Text:
The ABaC Hotel is a wonderfully intimate and luxurious boutique hotel. We booked the penthouse and absolutely love the coziness and decor of the room. The beautiful deck isn't the most useful during winter but the private jacuzzi is lovely and a wonderful way to wind down after a day of sightseeing. The rooms are advertised as soundproof and that's mostly true. You don't hear the traffic or noise from the streets but occasionally sounds from the elevator and downstairs can be heard (though to note, I'm supersensitive to sound). 

The service at ABaC is mostly to notch. Irene, who checked us in and helped us ought train tickets and find local sights to see was particularly helpful. However, another front desk person told us it was impossible to get train tickets without going to the station first and seemed completely uninterested in helping us (thank you Irene for making things easy!) 

The restaurant, which was just awarded its third Michelin star, is a MUST if you're here. It is an experience from beginning to end and worth every penny. 

While its not within walking distance of most tourist attractions, ABaC is right across the street from the very convenient and easy to use subway which is only a 10 minute ride to the main square. 

If you're looking for a quiet hotel a bit off the beaten path, this is it!

Title: Private Escape in Barcelona.
Text:
ABac was the last stop on our multi city tour of Spain. We wanted to relax and get ready for an early flight back to the states. 
When we arrived to the Hotel it is more of a coumpound in the city. It is very much a boutique hotel behind a large gate. We were buzzed in and in awe as we walked through the courtyard. As you walk through you can tell that time and attention is paid the the exterior of the hotel with well manicured plants and shrubbery. We entered the lobby and were checked in and shown to our room, we booked the Deluxe Suite. The room (and hotel) is very modern in design, the room was pristine with a chase lounge and oversized bed that was incredibly comfortable. Mood lighting illumates tge room as you enter and the minibar is full of delicious snacks. Although this hotel is out of the city center it is close to the theme park and other things to do. We ventured in the city and found great food and beverages and were ready to retire for the evening. The room has an amazing shower with privacy glass so you can see in the room as you shower but if anyone is in the room they canâ€™t see you. With a great waterfall shower and great smelling shower gels. Once we cozied into the comfortable bed we turned on the large Samsung 4K curved tv (I remember this because I wanted one) we were pleasantly surprised to find that Netflix was available. We watched a great movie and relaxed, also the rooms are soundproof which is great because you can turn up the volume and not worry. We woke up enjoyed coffee from the nespresso, packed and were ready to go. We didnâ€™t have much contact with the staff, but what when we did they were all polite and very courteous. I would definitely return to the 5+ star hotel, next time longer!

Title: Great location and well appointed
Text: ABaC hotel is a wonderful place to stay when visiting Barcelona. The perfect distance from the thick of things, just a short metro ride to whatever you want, located in a quiet neighborhood setting. Walking distance to excellent restaurants and shopping. very comfortable beds, excellent shower with rainfall shower head. Michelin restaurant located on premises. Right next door to a nice outside space. A short ride to the airport. i cant think of a single negative. It's all good.

Title: Luxury hotel
Text: Located in the north part of Barcelona, this isn't a luxury hotel with very attentive staff. Rooms clean and is located in a quieter part of Barcelona. The tour bus stops right outside the hotel, metro is easy too.  Spa is amazing. Las ramblas is about 45 minutes walk. Ideal hotel and would recommend highly.

Title: great restaurant and great hotel
Text: what an amazing hotel. staff is absolutely superb, go out of their way to help you. room are splendid, well worth your money. location is great as it is near to a metro station and Barcelona has a good network of metro,so you visit the city cheap and fast. restaurant there is just superb,outstanding. stay there if you can afford it. amazing.

Title: Superb Experience
Text: We were met after our cruise and taken to the hotel where upon arriving were met by the receptionist where the check in was prompt,efficient and very helpful. Our room was exceptional as were the spa facilities.  Breakfast was delicious.  This really is an exceptional member of the SLH,  to date our favourite I honestly don't think there is any area that could be improved on.  Keep up the excellent work look forward to seeing you again.

Title: Lovely boutique hotel
Text: Rooms are excellent. Staff go out of their way to help. The restaurant is an experience. The food was nice and the wine outstanding. Lots of money to spend on one meal, but as I said it's an experience.

Title: One of the World's Best Restaurants
Text:
My wife and I have been fortunate to travel extensively throughout Europe and the U.S. and our experience at ABaC restaurant was one of the best that we have had anywhere---a truly memorable experience. 
Even before we got there, whenever we mentioned the restaurant to anyone working in our hotel (The Arts), there was an automatic smile and raised eyebrows because they knew the experience we were about to have. 
One is initially greeted at the door in this very cool, very chic hotel/restaurant and brought by elevator to the restaurant level. One is then brought to an outdoor comfortable table where you are offered drinks and then brought the menu and absolutely huge wine list to make your choices. This takes about 15-20 minutes of total relaxation. Then you are brought into the kitchen where your guide presents the various areas of where the various dishes will be prepared.  Then while in the kitchen two different bites of starters are given to you. You are also given the opportunity to have your picture taken with Chef Jordi who is now regarded as one of the best chefs in the World. 
You are then led to your beautiful table in a beautifully designed modern dining area.  One then is pampered with the next 12-16 courses of foods depending whether you chose the 14 or 18 course selection.  That was the initial meal choice one had to make when you were initially brought into the restaurant. 

Although there are many courses, the portion sizes are just right so that one is not "stuffed" by the end of the meal. 
I'm a wine lover and their selection was outstanding. The sommelier is very knowledgeable and helpful as you would expect. We had a delicious 2006 Alion from Ribera Del Duero. 

Of course, this is one of those rare experiences that caries with it a rarified cost. But it is absolutely worth every penny. 
You will need to make a reservation directly with the restaurant, not through a concierge and you will need to make your reservation well in advance, preferably 2 months in advance. 

This is a unique dining experience and one of the best that you can have anywhere in the World. 

This is not listed as Trip Adviser's number one recommendation but that has to be because of the cost. 
BUT THIS IS THE NUMBER ONE RESTAURANT IN BARCELONA.

Title: Amazing stay second time around!
Text:
The only hotel we will ever stay at in Barcelona, and they did it again! Awesome stay at a top hotel. Second time in Barcelona, second time we stayed here, first time was 2 years ago. The place is just as good as before with some improvements. Staying here is like being at home, it is our home away from home. The TV and sound system I think was a improvement from last time, its really nice! Wi-fi is fast as well.

Last time we had breakfast included in the stay, this time we didn't, but only cuz we didn't book the hotel far enough in advance where it was a reasonable cost for us, so we skipped it this time, we booked this in Canadian dollars, so it gets expensive. The rooms are worth the price, the room is amazing! 2 years ago we got the room at a really good price, so got the breakfast included, and it was amazing and I highly recommend the breakfast here as it is better than anything we found in Barcelona.
We wanted to order room service for dinner, but we didn't get to it because we ate at our favorite restaurant everyday in Barcelona :). But we heard amazing stuff about the restaurant food!

Tips for travel: So close to the metro (L7) which goes straight to Placa de Catalunya. Perfect and metro is cheap when you get the T-10 metro card (can be shared).
The location is perfect, anywhere in Barcelona you need to metro it anyways, so this is at least one straight line to the main city center. Fast and easy, we would go back and fourth 2 times a day.

Title: Amazing dinner!!  Top 5 of our life so far.
Text: The kitchen visit to the excellent delivery and amazing courses make this one of the best meals you can have.  Ever!!!  You must go to this great restaurant and enjoy some of the best food with a fine wine.    A must visit.

Title: Changing dates- mission impossible
Text:
The worst experience with the hotel manager over the phone. We have booked the hotel on Chase Reserve Card awards for five nights in  September. Unfortunately my brother passed and we needed to changed the dates for August. We were aware that once we book the hotel with awards we cannot make changes on the reservation. Considering that this is an extraordinary circumstances, I was hoping that this hotel of supposedly five stars would understand and change the dates. I wasn't trying to be reimbursed, simply reschedule. Rooms were available of course. The hotel manager was the most insensitive person I ever spoken to. Rude and abrasive, he should be fired, person like this does not belong in the service industry. Mind you, we have made a different reservation also with awards, same restrictions for September as well, at Chateau Valmer. Amazing handling and understanding of our situation from their front desk over the phone, our reservation was modified without any problems.
The bottom line, ABaC lost not just two customers, we will make sure all of our friends and family never stay at this five stars establishment with zero stars customer service and experience!
In addition, the location is not good at all. Too far away from everything.

Title: ABaC Hotel Is A True FIND!!!
Text:
We looked for a 5 star hotel in Barcelona for 2 nights prior to our cruise.  Experience in past travel has proven that that rating doesn't jive in all countries.  When we booked our stay at ABaC, I knew immediately that we made the right choice.  We immediately received a personal email thanking us for the booking & assuring us that we could ask anything that would make our stay better.  I use medical oxygen that needs electricity of recharge.  With only 15 guest rooms, it was a difficult promise to make, but they did have the room ready for us early.  They warmly greeted us & even afforded us a tour of the chef's very busy kitchen.  The room was amazing!  The grounds are amazing!  The service...superb.  This is not a 5 Star hotel, but instead a 6 Star in our books!
We'd recommend this hotel to EVERY ONE looking for being treated in a luxurious style!  Thank you ABaC staff!  You're the BEST of the BEST!

Title: Excellent and Unique Stay
Text: I really enjoyed this hotel, I can't thank the reception and dining service enough! Mateo and Irene at the reception desk really helped me with suggestions and itineraries. I also dined at the restaurant which was fantastic and such a great experience. Every single one of the restaurant staff were tremendous and friendly as well. I recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to experience something different then a large chain hotel, I can't stress enough what a fantastic experience this was!

Title: Every town has got it's own pearl, ABaC is Barcelona's one.
Text:
Writing this review make's me feel like Anton Ego, the famous recensist from Disney's masterpiece animated movie "Ratatouille", in which he quoted that taste is purely personal. Located near the "Ronda de Dalt" in a hilly neighborhood surrounded by beautiful single old houses, ABaC lies at a corner of the street where you can see the old tram moving up slowly towards the top of the hills. City center can be reached in a couple of minutes in one of the many available taxi's. 
The hotel has got all the ingredients which you're looking for as a guest. Staff which connect friendliness with professionality and empathy, rooms with all the comfort from calming beds to stunning bathrooms. All of this, including breakfast the way you want, gave us the extraordinary feeling of always coming back when visiting Catalunya.
And we didn't even had dinner in their 2 star restaurant. Can you imagine what a combination this is? We certainly can and will be back as soon as possible.

Title: Amazing experience
Text: This is a awesome hotel with great amenities. There aren't many units so it's always an ease to get in and out. The grounds are absolutely beautiful and would love to stay again. It's close to the subway station so you can pretty much get anywhere.

Title: wonderful way to spend time in barcelona
Text: great service with transport to hotel, very quiet facility and wonderful spa. Dinner was a evening to remember. Wish I had the recipe for the desert that was served on a pillow.  It was a sphere of spun sugar filled with icecream and chocolate. The hotel is  spotless and cant wait to return.

Title: Great hotel
Text: Fabulous small hotel in Barcelona. A little out of the heart of the city but well worth it. Taxi service and metro are available. Spotless. Restaurant is outstanding. Would not hesitate to stay there again.

Title: Classy Boutique Hotel
Text:
We arrived at the hotel and while checking in, the front desk staff member, offered us a welcome drink while she finished up the paperwork.  We sat outside in a beautiful garden area and had a glass of red wine.  We were then escorted to our room.  We got a corner room which was nice and spacious.  The only issue we had was the room smelt of cigarette smoke.  The staff member insisted that all rooms were non smoking and there was no way that anyone would nave smoked.  She seemed immune to the smell of smoke.  The room was modern and sound proofed.  The bed was extremely comfortable.
The next night we made a reservation at the AbaC restaurant which was rated 2 Michelin star.  It was highly recommended and we were excited.  We were there at 8pm and had a glass of wine while relaxing in the courtyard garden.  They had an array of well dressed staff ready to start dinner service.  One staff member brought out the menu and asked us to select between 18 course or 15 course menu.  We picked the 18 course menu.  We were shown to our table.  
Once seated the waiter told us that the first 2 appetizers would be served in the kitchen with a tour of the kitchen area.  The first 2 appetizers were refreshing and quite good.  We went back to our table.  The dishes kept coming but the girl who explained each dish was not well trained and was hard to understand - she spoke too fast as if she had memorized each description !!  The dishes were quite bland even though the presentation were beautiful.  There were not enough hot dished - quite disappointing.  This is no "French Laundry'.
After 2 nights in the smoke room we asked to be moved to another room.  This time the girl who came to make the switch could clearly smell the smoke.  We were moved to a smaller room which was annoying.  
The location of Abac was quite far to the main city- 15 euro taxi ride.  
Overall the hotel was quite nice for our first visit to Barcelona.  The front desk staff were very helpful in planning day trips and making dinner reservations.

Title: Fabulous Hotel
Text: A beautiful, calm oasis in a relatively "untouristy" area of the city but still just a short taxi ride to the city center.  Rooms are quiet and have an elegant simplicity.  Staff is very helpful and most speak excellent English.  As we had an early am flight, could not take advantage of the Michelin starred restaurant, but the continental breakfast served en suite was delicious. The exercise room, spa and swimming pool were also pleasant surprises. Will definitely return when next in Barcelona.

Title: Unique experience with taste of exlusivity
Text:
My wife have booked us there as my birthday gift ... the best one I ever got in my life

ABAC is unique experience for those who love top class kitchen and service.
Booking needs to be made well in advance, few months ahead.

Hard to explain all the details and experience, but the word unique describes is best, from the first moment, during entire stay there that took us few hours to go through entire large degustation menu and enjoying  it fully, till leaving the place... and the mood, taste and absolute enjoyment lasts for weeks ...

Title: Expensive but beautiful, quiet property
Text: A very small, intimate and well kept property located several km from the city center but just a few meters from a subway station that will bring you there in minutes. Our room was large, unusually comfortable and equipped with electronically operated black out drapes.  The staff was attentive but not obtrusive.  We chose not to eat in its famed restaurant and we were directed by helpful staff to several options nearby. We found this property a slight bit overpriced but not outrageously so; the quiet and care made it a reasonable value.

Title: Supreme Service
Text:
The rooms, staff, and service were 5 star hands down. 
Houses a 2 michelin star restaurant. 
Staff gave us a tour of the room and went through everything - including how to work the shower! 

Would stay there again in a heartbeat. 

Parking was 40$ /day - i think this should be a courtesty to their guests, especially since its such a small hotel.

Title: Brilliant Stay
Text: An awesome hotel and restaurant experience.  The hotel itself lives up to its promise of s unique boutique hotel with very friendly service and all possible amenities.  The restaurant was simply brilliant - every dish a work of art!

Title: Escher Design but Superb
Text:
This is a very modern style of hotel with a somewhat confusing layout having two elevators and clear sides to the building. This caused some confusion in our party. The rooms are lovely and well apportioned and our terrace was fantastic. 

We ate dinner in the restaurant which was amazing and I'll review elsewhere. 

All in all a little eclectic but rather wonderful

Title: Great Boutique hotel!  Fabulous service!
Text: My husband and I stayed 2 nights at the ABAC hotel before departing our cruise. Wonderful  personal service, beautiful room and charming property. $15 cab ride or subway to city center from this hotel located in a close-in upscale neighborhood. There is also a 2 star Michelin  restaurant here. However, we were not able to dine at the restaurant during our short stay. Would definitely stay here again. My only negative is that I wish the lighting in the bathroom was better.

Title: give it a miss
Text:
This up market hotel is not centrally located and although aspires to be a 5 star hotel, is far from the mark.

The onsite Michelin restaurant certainly  has the priority here (in terms of staff availability, access, and room service).  This leaves the hotel somewhat wanting.

For instance, during our stay we called on room service from the hotel staff on 4 occasions; 3 out of 4 failed to deliver in a timely fashion. In fairness, they acknowledged the 1 hour plus response time and gave us the items for free.  While that is responsible, it did not meet our needs, and I would rather get adequate service than not pay for what is requested. 

The room (a junior suite) was nice.  The bed was comfortable, the rain shower luxurious, internet speed fantastic and sound and vision very modern. It is a pity that more time is not spent on making this hotel great rather than as an after-thought.

.In summary, the house staff are very pretentious ( I wanted  a bottle of red wine with our evening room service meal (ordered because the restaurant was not available to house guests unless booked months in advance, and I was offered a 1200 euro bottle as the first choice: we settled on a 200 euro wine that met our purposes),  I was advised prior to arrival by the front desk, while trying to orgainse a restaurant dinner that I could not wear shorts or flip-flops.  Really, perhaps I should have asked whether I could wear my room bathrobe and underwear  instead?

I could not, in good conscience, recommend this hotel.  The service was the worst experienced in our 4 week trip to Europe. We were made to feel uncomfortable and not wanted and I have experienced much better options (try El Palace in Barcelona if you want a good hotel).

The 2 star Michelin restaurant may be great but I could not get in to try, and the hotel is very much less than adequate.

Title: PERFECTION!
Text: The best hotel experience I've ever had! This was the first stop on our honeymoon, and it was worth every penny. The customer service and concierge was top notch, any/everything we needed they got us asap. Wonderful with the language barrier as well, as we only knew some Spanish. The breakfast was delicious and the 17 course dinner was absolutely phenomenal! And the spa, WOW! Best massage I've ever had, and the cold pool and hot tub was so tranquil and relaxing. We love ABaC!!!! Couldn't say more wonderful things about this hotel, wish we could have stayed longer and hope to come back one day! Thank you for making our honeymoon so memorable.

Title: High standard and elegant
Text: This hotel is really 5stars as it has the most wonderful architecture, a fantastic spa with jacuzzi chairs and everything you can imagine! There is a fabulous terrace in which you can eat breakfast out in and it overlooks the charming gardens. They were all so Helpful and professional! We can't wait to come back! Thank you for making our honeymoon so lovely! Emily and Chris humphrey xx

Title: Great stay
Text:
We booked this hotel as it's part of SLH and we where never disappointed .

The staff and management : excellent 

Room : excellent 

Service :  excellent 

Breakfast : excellent 

Restaurant 2 star Michelin : an experience not to be missed .

Spa : outstanding .

Location : very quite and relaxing .

Would definitely come back to abac hotel .

Title: Attention to detail
Text: It was an excellent experience. The attention to detail that Jordi Cruz' crew had for us throughout the evening was flawless. They made sure we felt comfortable at all times and everything went perfectly. Furthermore, the meal was incredible. Each dish surprised us with exotic flavours and bold combinations we would have never imagined. Congratulations to Jordi Cruz and everyone working there!

Title: Beautiful resort
Text: A beautifully crafted boutique resort. A lovely located away from the busy city life. The staff are generously nice. The cage is lovely. The rooms are nice, clean and fitted with all modern amenities. Beautifully crafted resort.

Title: Wonderful Botuque Hotel
Text: My wife and I stayed here before going to a wedding in Mallorca.  This is a wonderful small boutique hotel located in an upscale residential part of Barcelona.  The hotel is extremely modern (which may be a good thing or a bad thing), very clean with well appointed, quiet guest rooms.  The staff was extremely friendly and mostly helpful.  This hotel is not located in the center of town, so if you are looking to stay at a hotel that is in the middle of it all, this is probably not the place.  However, there is a bus stop and metro station right outside of the hotel and transportation to the various sites by public transportation is relatively easy.  The Hop-On, Hop-Off Bus also stops at the hotel.  The "front desk/concierge" staff tries to be helpful with sightseeing and restaurant recommendations but sometimes falls short of the mark.  One reason for this is that the staff at the desk in the mornings and during the day are extremely busy (answering two phones, buzzing guests into the hotel, working on two computers, having discussions with other hotel staff ) and are often distracted.  Accordingly, sometimes the advise you get is not 100% accurate (e.g., inaccurate travel times, sending you to restaurants that are indeed closed, etc.).  That is the only reason I gave this hotel a four instead of a five star rating.  If you don't mind not being in the center of town, you really can't go wrong with a stay at this hotel.

Title: 60th birthday lunch
Text:
This is one of our favourite places in the world and whilst now living in New Zealand when deciding on a place to celebrate my 60th birthday there was no where else I wanted to go.
There was a massive welcome from the staff when we arrived and when we got to our room there were 60 birthday balloons and a bottle of wine in the room.

Title: Oh, That Bed!!
Text: We had a very short (unfortunately) stay at ABaC, but I will return just to sleep in that bed again!  It was the most luxurious evening we've ever spent in a hotel.  The rooms are sound-proof, a Nespresso machine is provided, and it had one of the coolest bathrooms.  The staff were thoughtful and helpful, and gave us some great trips for exploring the area.  Although the hotel is located on a busy intersection, inside the beautiful garden it feels so tranquil. Can't wait to return and spend a few nights at this delightful property.

Title: This is not just a dinner
Text: Dinner at this restaurant is a fabulous experience not just somewhere nice to eat.   Go with an open mind, try  everything and experience probably the best cooking in Barcelona. The place is lovely but I was expecting that.   The service is brilliant and probably better than I expected.  The effort that goes into the food is amazing and I couldn't have picked a better place for the celebration I wanted.  They cope very well with dietary requirements (not that I had any) but theses guys know what they are doing so try and let them give you a dinner you won't forget.

Title: I don't even know where to start ...
Text:
A pure moment of bliss and "rafinement" as french would say.
The staff, The penthouse room, The spa, The room service  were perfect.
The cherry on the cake was the dinner at the 2 Michelin award winning Jordi Cruz restaurant a pure moment of heaven.
I would say Congratulations to all we will come back.

Title: Lovely little property in the middle of the city but rude service
Text: The property itself is very cute and I enjoyed our balcony overlooking the garden very much. Our room was clean and quite spacious. We ate dinner at the Abac restaurant and the service was appalling we ate at 8 other michelin starred restaurants during our week in Spain; Abac and one other restaurant both had terrible, rude service. There was one memorable dish but not good enough to go back for.

Title: Not quite there
Text: On arrival you press a button for entry and in you go to see lovely kept gardens the pavement leading to the main  entrance however is not great for suitcases on wheels be prepared to carry your bags .the staff are friendly and  polite we were taken to our room the penthouse and I have to say first  impressions WOW well worth the extra cost until the tv stopt working and the taps in the sink on the 2nd day one of the staff came up to have a look and said they would get it sorted that was the last I herd (not very good  customer service )I was still there for another 3 days only had my iPad to watch instead of one of the biggest TVs I have ever seen a big selling point for this room I would think!!having said that if these things were sorted out then it would have been perfect the terrace out side was  Beautiful with a  jacuzzi lovely eating area sunbeds and somewhere to have breakfast in the morning overlooking the city .getting down to  las  ramblas was â‚¬15 each way in a cab not to bad or about 40min walk.

Title: Beautiful experience
Text: We finished our 10 day tour of Spain with a lovely stay, spa treatments and dinner at ABaC. The room was very comfortable with nice linens, bath products. Dinner was decadent and delicious, starting with appetizers in the lounge, then a tour of the wine cellar and kitchen before dinner in the dining room. Sommelier was very knowledgable and helpful, staff were accommodating all around. Spa was great treat with multiple baths, sauna, steam room before our treatments. A great treat to finish our trip.

Title: Honeymoon Heaven
Text:
My husband and I chose the AbAc for our honeymoon. We were only in Barcelona for 3 nights but wanted 3 nights of luxury and that is what we got!! 
Champagne on arrival and a free upgrade to the suite! Bonus! 
The hotel is stunning, stylish, fresh and pristine! 
The rooms are spacious with incredible showers/baths and toiletries! The bed is 100% the comfiest bed we have slept in! The sheets and the pillows were out of this world! We are tempted to get in touch with the hotel to see where we can get the pillows from!!! 
We had a meal in the hotel restaurant the first night! The experience was out of this world! So professional and the food was to die for!!! 
We walked to the city centre once, it is literally straight down for 40 minutes and you are in the city centre! We got the tour bus for 2 days and there is a stop right outside the hotel so that was our transport sorted! 
If you don't have breakfast at the hotel there is a lovely little cafe opposite the hotel that do gorgeous sandwiches and coffee and pastries! 
I really can't emphasise how wonderful the hotel was and the staff! I would recommend this hotel to anyone wether it's a stay with friends or a romantic getaway! 
Thank you AbAc for making our honeymoon memorable and spectacular!! 
P.s Barcelona is pretty cool too!!

Title: Great hotel and restaurant
Text:
We stayed in a large group mostly couples.
 What an amazing hotel and very modern.
The room we stayed very white and a great layout. glass wall to shower and a full wet room so make sure you don't turn the taps if your not ready...
Well situated for what we wanted. Would highly recommend and the restaurant is amazing you can walk through the kitchen it's not every day you can see the team at work.

Title: Location, perfect - quality, assured.
Text: This hotel ticked all our boxes and had none of the things we always seek to avoid. From the moment we were picked up at Barcelona airport the staff could not have been more helpful and attentive. We were fortunate enough to have booked the Penthouse room and, even at the end of February, this was a real bonus (we were also lucky with the weather, in fairness) as we could sit out in the sunshine and enjoy the feeling of seclusion. The hot-tub was also a lovely way of starting and ending busy days sightseeing. The room itself was light, spacious, very well appointed and we never heard another guest (something very rare these days). The novelty of walking through the kitchen to reach reception and the restaurant never wore off, particularly as the kitchen team were always keen to show their workplace off. Such is the ease of using the Metro in Barcelona that the ABaC is perfectly located just a short stroll across the road to the last stop on the L7 which goes straight through the heart of the city and thereby making all the main sights very accessible - just buy a T10 ticket and you'll be surprised at just how good value the Metro is, even though we also walked the equivalent of a marathon in 3 days enjoying as much of the city as we could. The real bonus of the hotel was being able to explore the city among all the crowds and then we could retreat to our haven of serenity and peace away from all the hustle and bustle of city life. We spent four nights there and just wanted it to be longer. Thank you to all of the staff at the ABaC - we will definitely be returning.

Title: Fantastic hotel with great staff
Text: I read many reviews before choosing a hotel in Barcelona and I chose this one based on the good reviews. I wasn't wrong, from the moment you arrive you feel welcome and looked after and the staff are so helpful and pleasant. This is without doubt the best hotel we stayed in and can't wait to return and it goes without saying the food is fantastic too.

Title: Can't speak highly enough About Hotel
Text: Beautiful boutique hotel, with a great location.  Not in the centre of everything, located in the older part of the town, but this suited us fine.  The hotel is literally a historical building surrounded by gardens.    Very minimalistic, modern, clean and staff could not have been more helpful, nothing was too much trouble for them, they seemed to get everything right.  Loved the bar, loved the cocktails, loved the people.  I can't speak highly enough about this hotel, and would definitely recommend.

Title: Luxurious and serene and want to live in this hotel!!!
Text: This boutique hotel nestled near the top of the mountain was without a doubt one of the most beautiful boutique hotels.  The staff, without any hesitation are nothing short of service excellence.You need anything and in a blink of an eye it is taken care of. The rooms are large, the bathroom modern and so much attention to detail and design. And the bed- I could fall asleep! Barcelona is a magical city- the location of the hotel made me think of Montreal. Do yourself a favour and stay here - it won\t disappoint.

Title: Amazing stay
Text: Stayed here in 2015 August. It was fantastic. Staff was so friendly and inviting, rooms were amazing. They don't have a gym or pool, but they have a partnership with someone so you can leave the hotel and use that. I have no idea where it is because I never used it, but great to have that option. Right next to transit so it's so easy to get anywhere. Loved it. Will be back one day, won't stay any where else in Barcelona!

Title: Stunning food, excellent service
Text: Another wonderful short stay. Can't recommend the restaurant dining experience highly enough. Hotel modern and cosy, service attentive. Check the prices of the airport transfers, particularly out of hours, but otherwise outstanding.

Title: Sanctuary
Text:
The Abac hotel, whilst being about a 10 minute taxi ride to La Rambla was the perfect style of hotel to call home after spending all day touring this busy city. 
The decor is stylish, the rooms luxurious, the staff friendly and the ambience one of a secluded spa resort. We will definitely return.

Title: Amazing
Text: This was really absolutely amazing. The room was fantastic ( had a suite) and the service excellent yet I had the feeling of intimacy. If you want a treat, that's the place! I also tried the restaurant! A dream!

Title: Great Neighborhood
Text: The ABAC is in an older part of town but has all the amenities of a 5-star hotel. Very minimalistic. Dinner is quite nice and the breakfast is too.  Very nice reception. The room we had was quite small but had a huge curved HDTV.

Title: Trying to be the Ritz and Four Seasons, but not there.
Text:
Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights for business.  Very small hotel with 15 rooms.  Grounds are lovely and well maintained in a chaotic busy town. It felt like you were in a different world. The spa and lounge are very small, but nice. No pool or workout area, which I found odd given the caliber of hotel this is trying to project.  I had to walk 5 minutes from the hotel to exercise at a gym, which they had an agreement with.  The room was nice, however there were odd moldy smells from the shower and sink. The bed was comfortable and the rooms were very quite. They forgot to perform turn down service twice during my stay. The room was tiled with a throw rug which was filthy.  The front desk personal were nice, however during check out I had to wait approximately 20 minutes, because it was unattended. The service was poor compared to the Ritz or Four seasons.

The gourmet breakfast was included.  I ordered this three times, because I was not notified 2 other times because of the turn down service.  I requested 7AM in room one day and it arrived on time.  Second day I requested 7:15AM and it arrived at 8AM.  Third time I requested 7:15 and it arrived at 7:30 this is not appropriate for a high end hotel.

The first gourmet breakfast was very good and enjoyable.  However this was not consistent.  Second gourmet breakfast did not have the orange juice order, the ham order, or the pastry basket found this very odd.  Third gourmet breakfast the omelet was under cooked and runny, the shoulder ham was ordered all three times and was serviced differently all times.  I found the lack of consistency to be inappropriate again staying in a hotel of this supposed caliber. Another small touch that was missing was a bottle of water during turn down, again you expect this like this in this type of hotel.

For the money, overpriced for what you get.  I should have looked into staying at the Ritz

Title: An incredible gem of a hotel!
Text:
This was our second stay at the ABaC hotel having enjoyed 4 nights there previously in the penthouse room celebrating our 20th wedding anniversary.  We said at the time it was a 'once in a lifetime' experience. We were wrong.  Within 12 months we were back in the same room for 3 nights and the hotel didn't disappoint again.  So what makes it so special to us?  Firstly, the amazing private balcony that when you out enjoying the sun, it feels like a sanctuary in the city.  Add outdoor dining and a hot tub and things do not get much better!  Inside the room, the most comfortable bed (it's huge too!) along with understated dÃ©cor make it a great place to relax. 
Between our stays, the hotel have improved a few things we noticed were looking dated (a new TV and replaced wooden flooring) so it was good to see that they are investing in keeping the room up to scratch. Other things that need investment are the rain shower needs replacing as it doesn't work very well and water leaks out from under the bathroom floor when it is on and it could do with a paint.  However, I must stress these are minor points and would not stop us returning to this stunning hotel.

Title: A lovely hotel, but the restaurant is disgusting
Text:
The ABaC Hotel, from the outside, does not look like a hotel, rather more like a modernist mansion of glass, steel, and wood, hidden behind towering wooden gates in a leafy suburb of Barcelona. Once inside the modern-minimalist ethic continues, shaded on the sumptuous side, with electric curtains, B&O televisions, a shower that imitates a torrential rainstorm, and many other dazzling accoutrements. Our experience of the hotel was generally excellent, save for the receptionist bizarrely suggesting that we take the train to Figueres on a day of the week when no such train was scheduled.

Dinner in the hotelÂ´s restaurant, on the other hand, was a terrifying disaster. Months prior to our trip we had sent my wifeÂ´s stringent dietary requirements to the hotel reception, asking if the restaurant would be able to accommodate her concerns. We received comforting assurances that the restaurant would be so inclined. When we sat down for dinner, however, after confirming his awareness of my wifeÂ´s dietary concerns and promising to adjust the menu accordingly, the waiter refused to disclose the list of courses he had selected, declaring summarily â€œThat will not be necessary. All of the courses I will bring to you will be fine for you to eat.â€ However, as each successive plate arrived, it was clear that the waiter had simply ignored my wifeÂ´s requirements and delivered the standard menu without any adjustments. Here are a few examples:

â€¢	My wife had requested that everything be cooked well done, nothing raw or rare. In fact, she was served nearly-raw mussels, squid, shrimp, and eggs, all of which turned her stomach and would not even sample.
â€¢	My wife had requested that nothing be fried, yet, in fact, was served fried bread and fried seaweed.
â€¢	My wife found the shrimp dish to be disgustingly offensive, as we were instructed to suck the raw intestines, full of fecal matter, from the head of the shrimp.

In contrast to my wife, I sampled everything that was served. Unfortunately, I found all of the dishes to be extraordinarily bland and lifeless, as though all of the flavor had been surgically removed. Many of the dishesÂ´ decorative affectations were simply juvenile, uniformly detracting from the experience. Amid our obvious dissatisfaction the servers became tense and lifeless, repeating their memorized descriptions on automatic pilot.

At the end of our meal, my wife spoke to the waiter about her feelings of betrayal and abuse. In response, the waiter became immediately caustic and defensive, suggesting that we never should have come to the ABaC restaurant, because â€œthis is what we do here.â€

I suggest strongly that the hotel management must reinvent their restaurant, invest in all new staff, and create a new culture that starts with respect and kindness toward the client, not to mention delivering wonderful meals with vividly identifiable flavors, honest ingredients, and satisfyingly delicious outcomes. 

In summary, the ABaC hotel itself is very nice, but if you choose to stay there you would be well advised to plan to have all your meals at some other place in Barcelona, at least until the hotel fixes their reprehensible kitchen situation.

Title: Great service and very clean hotel
Text: We stayed at this facility for 2 nights and it was one of the most amazing hotels I have ever been to. The facility is very clean and the staff is amazing . We also had dinner at the restaurant , we had the 15 course menu. It was wonderful .

Title: Upscale,Romantic and very clean
Text: This was our last hotel out off 3 we stayed here for 3 days Saturday and Sunday this hotel has only 15 rooms it's very private. The hotel itself is great there is gardens everywhere and it's made for couples. They also have a spa area down stairs with a humman and also 2 beds In the water with jets. The rooms really pretty big and the beds are sooo comfy. They also have a bath tube and also in the same area have a rain shower which is really neat. We paided 630 for 2 days with breakfast include( there breakfast was very good with a fruit cup also) The gentlemen at the front desk we did not get his name was great he was very helpful and easy to work with. We also ordered tea to the room and the service was great came right away. Thy have some channels in English a lot more than the princess hotel and Olivia balmace which only had 2. There is also a restaurant on site but it only has 2 options a 13course meal(133) or a 16 course meal(170 at 3 hours) I mean it was neat to try but very long. The hotel is a little bit north Off the man area I would say 10 to 15 min ride or the beach around 25 mins. But if you are looking for a quite place to relax with your other and have a upscale hotel this is the one I would highly recommend it. If you have any questions feel free to email me

Title: Restaurant Michelin 2, excellent good price point.
Text: I had the tasting menu 16 course with wine pairing.  My favorite dish was the quail egg with risotto. It was succulent.  2 dishes out of the 16 I wasn't a fan of.  One was a squid with black ink coated rice.  It didn't sit well on my pallet.  The sommelier was knowledgable.  Overall incredible experience.  I have friends coming next week and told them they must eat here.

Title: Fantastic Service, Amazing Room!
Text: What a wonderful experience at this hotel!  We were looking for a nice hotel to stay in for a few days for my young daughter to recuperate from unexpected emergency surgery.  The penthouse suite happened to be available for those days.  Totally private, beautiful view, spacious deck with dining table, loungers and hot tub.  Bed was wonderfully comfortable and the entire staff was so helpful and kind to us.  We were not able to eat in the restaurant, but the room service meals we had were fantastic.  Truly an unexpected delight!

Title: Amazing experience !!
Text: A must ! The staff are out of this world !! Wine list world class !! The beautiful outside seating is class. Each course and wine described beautifully. Thank you so much for this experience. The main thing was that my wife was happy at the end of the evening.

Title: Just great!
Text:
Class and comfort join in this amazing place. In ABaC they care every single detail! It is an experience not just an stay!
Most comfortable bed you can sleep on!
And the service is all the time trying to make you feel relaxed and very helpful if need any assistance. 
Congratulations!
Al

Title: ðŸ‘ŒðŸ¼
Text:
My partner and I enjoyed 7 nights with the team at ABaC. Below are the highlights. 

The bed: Ridiculously comfortable and extremely hard to leave. 

Rain shower: 10/10. 

Metro: The metro stop in 200m away from the hotel, thus making trips into the city a breeze. It's the final stop on the line and only takes 12 minutes to find is way into the city. 

Room service: We were unable to book a reservation in the restaurant which was the only disappointing part of our stay, however the room service is restaurant quality.

Title: Great room, quiet but distant location, a few glitches
Text: Room amazing, very comfortable and spacious and we had long windows on 3 sides, good shower. Quiet residential location but 10 minute walk to nearest metro or 20 minute taxi ride into the center which was ok but disruptive if you wanted to go back to the room during the day. Good spa although jacuzzi water lukewarm. Only food option is Michelin star abac restaurant, breakfast is â‚¬31 per head! Would go back but for a 5 star it has some glitches

Title: nice for couples
Text: this hotel is great. lovely staff with excellent service, clean hotel which is the thing I look out for the most. good for couples, blackout curtains for the huge windows. would recommend. only thing is bottom floors smell heavily like food because of the restaraunt.

Title: Outstanding
Text: We stayed at this hotel on the way to our holiday destination T Costa Brava. This boutique hotel was amazing. The rooms (more like a suit) were very clean. The beds were comfortable. Glass shower amazing. We even visited the restaurant which was top also class.

Title: Amazing food
Text:
Simplify exceptional. We went for the more extensive tasting menu as it was my husband's 40th birthday and was blown away with the quality of the food and the service of the staff. We got to meet the chef Jordi Cruz at the end which was lovely. 

Not cheap but worth the money and would definitely return.

Title: Great place
Text: We stayed 3 nights at ABaC and we loved this place. The room was superb with a great bathroom and superb facilities. The staff was excellent and everything was perfect. The breakfast in the garden was excellent with great food and excellent service. The hotel is a bit out of town (which we enjoyed!) but the city centre can be easily reached by Metro (10 minutes). Overall an amazing boutique hotel and clearly our first choice for our next visit to Barcelona.

Title: Maravilloso
Text: We stayed here for two nights on our journey from the UK to Murcia and had such a wonderful time we decided to book again for the return trip. The staff were extremely helpful and pleasant, nothing was too much trouble. We had dinner in the restaurant and although our dislike of fish can be somewhat challenging with tasting menus, the chefs came up with some wonderful replacement dishes. The wine pairings were just perfect and really complemented each course. We would highly recommend the hotel and restaurant and will certainly be returning.

Title: A quiet oasis in a great location
Text:
Absolutely loved the rooms!!! From the large bed with softest sheets to the fluffiest pillows and the nightly turn down service with delicious chocolates! 
Our trip was made memorable by the smiling friendly staff. The check-in included a tour of the amenities in the property and even the kitchen!! 
Our room tariff included the breakfast that was a delicious start to the day with fresh fruits and a selection of breads, meat and an egg dish that is simply out of this world. We were served by an attentive and friendly staff (who is from Chile- sorry forgot his name!). 
The hotel is ideally located away from the tourist crowds but next to all connections for public transport. During our 5day stay we needed the taxi only to and from the airport. 10-12 minutes ride on the metro took you to Plaza Catalunya. From there connections were easy with the Barcelona card. Do not miss the guided walking tour of Park Guell. 
At the hotel restaurant we also enjoyed a special dinner one the eve of our departure. We chose the 16 course meal with wine pairing. They accommodated our dietary requirements to create some delicious dishes! Highly recommend the wine pairing as the sommelier's selection complemented each dish beautifully!! The wine pairing with the dessert was a revelation!! The meal ended with an option to smoke cigars and enjoy coffee after some very creative desserts. Special mention to their wonderful staff for the evening- Ammar! 

What could have been different? 
The entry- The first time you go in, the entry to the hotel is confusing. Make sure you get clear instructions. 
Housekeeping- forgot to replenish toiletries a couple of times- not a big deal though! 
The shower- beautiful and large rain head shower in a tiny cubicle that was not easy to maneuver in and out! 

Overall a great experience that made the trip even more memorable!! 
Highly recommend it for a couples retreat.

Title: We felt tucked away, at this quiet, romantic, retreat in Barcelona...
Text:
We had a suite of some sort, all very beige and white.  Calming and zen like.  The bathroom was fabulous, the living room was nice to have, and the bed was nice and firm.  The room was well appointed, and had terrific lighting.

The check-in/Front Desk staff are terrific, welcoming, and have your best interests at heart.  They helped me with a variety of questions and recommendations, they were all very good at what they did, and how they helped me and my husband.
