We had the grand ABaC , a 16 course meal , it was incredible , my taste buds were taken to places I have never experienced . The service is impecible ever thing is done to military precision in a very relaxed atmosphere . Be prepared to give the meal at least 4 hours , it will not be shorter but you will savour every minute 
The bedrooms  are very comfortable , with everything you could wish for .
Thank you Paul

Title: Fabulous Boutique hotel
Text:
So pleased we picked this amazing hotel to celebrate our wedding anniversary. Everyone was really helpful, polite, friendly and welcoming. Breakfasts were amazing . Hotel as stated is sound proof. A secluded hotel with first class service. Great views. We stayed in room 812 with a fantastic terrace. 
the Metro was literally across the road and so this was really easy to get to the centre of Barcelona, the beach etc etc.
We would highly recommend this beautiful hotel. 
Thank you to everyone at the ABaC

Title: Wowee wow wow wow!!!!
Text: Talk about living in the lap of luxury. My husband found this hotel on Trip Advisor and we had high expectations with the excellent ratings. We were definitely not disappointed. We loved everything. The room had fun electronic blinds, the most absolutely comfortable bedding and bed, a super modern bathroom complete with an LED lighted spa. The spa downstairs was AMAZING!! The pools, steam room, heated stone loungers were great. My only regret was not staying longer!

Title: Fantastic Stay
Text:
Truly relaxed and great staff - with Jordi's food, made an exellent weekend.
The area is a little in the back of Barcelona, but great to get away from the hectic center.
Just top nuch and I would recommend it at all times.
JÃ¸rgen

Title: Wonderful hotel with an amazing Restaurant
Text:
This luxury hotel in Barcelona is like an oasis of calm with first class, friendly service for the duration of the stay.
We booked the hotel because we wanted to eat in the restaurant. The service, the food, the atmosphere are first class. Considering the quality of room, service etc. this place is good value for money.

Title: ABaC never disappoints!
Text:
This was our fourth stay at ABaC, and this stay only confirmed why this is our favorite hotel in Barcelona (and possibly the world!)

We again stayed in the room on the top floor because we love the deck, the view and the hot tub after a long day of walking in the city.  We had a remarkable lunch at the incredible restaurant on the first floor -- an experience not to be missed.  They were filming B roll of Jordi Cruz, the Michelin starred chef, for his judging position on the Spanish version of Master Chef.  The grounds are beautifully maintained and so peaceful away from the rush of the central city.  Although the streets surrounding the hotel are reasonably busy, you don't hear a sound in your room.

But it is the staff of the hotel that really make this hotel extraordinary.  They are attentive and personal.  They arranged tickets for an FC Barcelona game at Camp Nou for us without any fuss (much simpler than us trying to do it from the US on short notice).   They helped us figure timing and transportation for several of the things we were doing on this trip.

But our favorite staff member is the lovely woman who serves the fabulous breakfast in the morning.  She has been there since our very first visit and she is just a delight!  By your second breakfast, she knows your beverage choice and brings it to the table.  She even sent us off to the airport with a bag of the amazing fresh baked pastries on our last morning.  I feel dreadful that I do not remember her name, but it is that kind of person and personality that can make a wonderful hotel so memorable!

We will keep coming back to ABaC!

Title: Lovely hotel. Fantastic staff.
Text:
My husband and I spent a long weekend at this fantastic hotel and could not recommend it more. The meal we had in the restaurant was the best meal we have ever eaten. Absolutely superb!
The hotel is a little out of the centre, but very close to a tube stop, so this isn't a problem at all. Our room was fantastic. There was an extremely comfortable and spacious bed and we had modern furnishings throughout our suite. 
My husband was involved in a road accident the evening before we were due to return home and I cannot thank the hotel staff enough for their help, thoughtfulness and kindness. They truly went out of their way to make things as easy as possible for me.

Title: Wonderful stay at this very beautiful hotel
Text:
Absolutely fantastic stay at this beautiful and very stylish hotel.  The room was one of the nicest we've ever stayed in, and although expensive it was worth it. Very warm welcome (and glass of cava) from the staff who cannot do enough for you. 

The rooms are beautiful and have everything you could want - if you are into modern style and architecture then this is the place for you. Superb bed and bathroom and plenty gadgets to keep you happy! 

We enjoyed lovely drinks and cheese on the terrace for a light lunch, before heading out for a stroll around the surrounding area which although not in the central tourist belt (this is a good thing!) is a lovely residential area.  The metro is a few meters away and is very easy and cheap to use to transport you around Barcelona. 

We enjoyed an hour in the small spa which was lovely and almost like your own private spa as no one else was in it. The heated beds are a must for weary tourist legs! 

Dinner in the evening was absolutely superb, not to be missed. 

Similarly breakfast in the morning was one of the best I've ever had, very high quality and local ingredients imaginatively served by a charming lady who looked after us so well.  

Overall superb experience and a place I would love to return to.

Title: Amazing Stay
Text: If you are looking for the perfect boutique hotel to stay in, in Barcelona look no further. The only problem with this place is that the bed is cozy and amazing, it's hard to get up and get ready to tackle the city sights! Enjoy your stay.

Title: Great hotel - perfect service
Text:
My wife and I stayed here for a long weekend and the hotel is amazing, exactly how the website describes. It's very clean, we had a lovely room and, although slightly out of town, it's in a great location. Being slightly out of town allowed us to go for a really nice walk up the Tibidabo mountain (hill?) Which I think we'd have missed if we were in a more central location.

The service at the hotel was second to none. Greeted late when we arrived after midnight, with a glass of cava and the staff were immediately willing to show us the best locations to go in Barcelona. Also as we were staying for an anniversary, we chose to book a table at the hotel restaurant in advance (mainly because another review mentioned it was difficult to book in advance - thank you!) We had an awesome meal, 13 courses of some of the most amazing food ever, and the staff were brilliant all the way through, giving advice for wine and describing each course in English perfectly. We even had an additional course of chocolates and sweets that we definitely were not expecting.

Lastly, my wife was ill on our last night (not due to the hotel) and the staff in attendance (David and Paloma?) were brilliant - helping us get an earlier flight and being exceptionally understanding.

Despite the illness, we had a great time here and would highly recommend anyone consider this hotel. It's not cheap, but with every penny...

Title: Relaxing post Christmas get away...
Text: Spent a week in the ABac hotel over the post Christmas/New Years period. On arrival staff came out to help take our luggage from the taxi and the glass of Cava as soon as we sat down to check in was most welcome. Staff were friendly and accommodating, one member in particular took significant time to outline the various sights and hotspots in Barcelona on a map and provided details on how best to get around the city, in addition to showing us how to use the various amenities in the bedroom and bathroom. The rooms are very modern and chic, yet comfortable and cosy. Rooms have all the nice touches including bathrobes & slippers, comfortable couches and beautiful linens. My only gripe was the hair dryer which you had to hold the button down on permanently - a tad out of kilter with the standard of the rest of the amenities and the lack of any face cloths. We ordered room service on a couple of occasions (always omelettes) which was tasty and nicely presented. Breakfast is lovely...my favourite had to be the basil sorbet served with the fresh fruit salad. The bar downstairs is a cool spot for pre dinner drinks too. This place is pricey but is very well run...rooms should probably be a bit bigger however given the price.

Title: Birthday trip made very special December 2013
Text: Would highly recommend this hotel, the room was very clean, very well appointed , king size bed extremely comfortable and bathroom included both a rain shower and  jacuzzi bath. The staff were friendly, very polite and could not do enough for us. I received complimentary fresh fruit with a birthday card sent to the room which was a lovely touch to the very personal service we enjoyed throughout our stay. The breakfast was absolutely scrumptious, and the restaurant taster menu was a gastronomic delight. It is located in a quite area but with easy access to places of interest. The open top bus route and the metro all within 2 min walk of the hotel. The spa was an added bonus though small if hotel full. R Ince Lancashire UK

Title: Fantastic Hotel. Faultless Service
Text:
My wife and I recently returned from a weekend in Barcelona having been recommended to stay at the ABaC Hotel.

On arrival, the staff could not have been more polite and could not have been more helpful. After a brief check in, and a quick tour of the hotel, including the kitchen, we were taken to our 'Deluxe' room which was perfect for our 2 night stay. The facilities in the room included high speed wi-fi, a B&O TV, and Nespresso machine. The bed as other reviewer's have also said, was the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in. 

The hotel has a luxury spa with complimentary refreshments. Needless to say, we used the spa every day during our stay and found that we were in fact the only guests to use the facility.

The hotel is situated across the road from the subway which is the headstop for the L7 (Brown line). Within 10 minutes you are walking down La Rambla.

We didn't dine in the restaurant so can't comment, but if you want to stay in a small luxury hotel away from the hustle and bustle of central Barcelona, stay here. You can't go wrong.

We can't wait to return to the ABaC.

Title: Top notch gastronomic experience
Text: This is a place to take someone you really want to treat and enjoy a great dining night out. Ambience and atmosphere are very nice and create a warm, modern feeling. The chef prepares a couple of small welcome surprises for everyone to taste followed y in house baked bread. Wine list is extensive (especially in Spanish wines as one would have expected) and sommelier has done an excellent job in combining wines with food. We went for the degustation menu which involved several small plates. Highlights of these were the beef tartare done in 2 separate ways and the egg. These are ABAC signature dishes and i would go back again and again to taste these. Main dishes and deserts also at similar gastronomic levels with the starters. Service was very attentive by extremely profesional people. It is a joy and pleasure to see people like ABAC staff that take great joy and pride in what they do, this feeling is passed to the client in the utmost professional/friendly/discreet sort of manner, my deepest congratulations on the service.

Title: Lovely hotel with excellent restaurant !
Text:
This hotel was a bit away from the centre of Barcelona, but it was in a nice and lovely neighborhood. We had a suite and even though we were next to the road, we couldnt hear any noises from the roads outside. The Subway is just a cross the street and takes you straight down to La Rambla. The bed was very big and With the best cushions I have ever had in a hotel. 
The staff were very friendly and helpful. We celebrated our proposal there and while we ate at the restaurant the staff made a very romantic setting in our room With candles and flowers in the bath. 
The restaurant itself is worth the stay. The placement of our room made us walk through the Kitchen and what an experience. Wathcing twenty cooks create dinner was an Incredible sight. We went for the Grande menu with sixteen tastings. This sounds much, but is well worth it. Explosions of great taste in our mouth for every bite. The staff at the restaurant were very helpful and knew exactly when to serve and how to do it. Well worth a two star Michelin rating!!! If you are going for a romantic trip to Barcelona and want to celebrate something special, this is the place for you !
All in all, I couldnt get more satisfied With ABaV and their staff :)

Title: Top gourmet palace in Barcelona
Text: Quite a taxi journey from the port to the gates of food mecca ABaC at the foot of the mountains, but well worth it. Buzz the door at the gate, which swings open to a revel beautiful gardens and discreet luxury palisander architecture. This elegant two star restaurant also houses a hotel with 15 rooms. We were set for lunch, and had three starters. Large round tables generously spaced in a kool dining room on the minimalistic side, Zalto champagne glasses taking care of texture and bouquet. The sommelier were informed of our lacking competence on white Spanish wine, and with a hint of preference pointing to the Ramonet chassagne at â‚¬140, he recommended priorat wine Mas dÂ´en compte 2008 from Cal Pla. Lovely elegant wine, mineral and rich almost without oak. The kitchen impressed from beginning to end, the servuce was considerate, friendly and as loose as possible at this level of fine dining - but never stiff. It seemed they took their pride in knowledge and presentation, and we felt immensely taken care of in a friendly and relaxed way by our Argentinian maitre and his MMA-looking sommelier. They and their staff of waiters did their best to secure not our luxurious lunch, but also were helpful making reservations and recommendations at similar restaurants for the rest of our stay. Mixed crowd, relaxed dressed catalan intellectual couple, the omnipresent plastically surgery of Americans discussing their favorite topic (themselves) and local beauties from the Catalan capitol, elegantly dressed. The dining hours are quite a challenge, having 7-12 course lunch at 4 and then dinner at...11? 12? But this food and wine temple is a must when visiting Barcelona for the food experiences. Nitro cocktails, gazpacho as sorbet, tiny gnocchi filled with liquid (!) parmesan, yuzu desserts, the meal is a gem from start to finish, well worth the bill just short of â‚¬380 including a well deserved although generous tip. The compositions are a delight for the eye, fun to eat, impressively considerate and intelligently manufactured. With the horribly stressed frenetic dishes fast-food delivered at well reputed Dos Palillos the night before, the perfect timing of each dish at ABaC was an  academic pleasure of epic fine dining in our new favorite fine dining country. ABaC, we salute you!

Title: Out of the way but worth it
Text: We stayed at the ABAC hotel in Barcelona for 4 nights. The location was away from the main touristy part of town which made it very quiet pleasant. However, It was close to an easy to use metro so we had no problem getting to the main attractions.The service was wonderful; the staff was courteous and helpful. The rooms were very modern and comfortable. Our only complaint was the bathrooms were a little too modern - the shower was unusual - one room for both the shower and tub even though they were separate.

Title: Never coming Abac!
Text:
I stayed two nights in September, and the stay was a disaster from start to finish. To be honest, I just want to forget the experience, but Iâ€™m going to put it up here anyways. While there were several issues â€“ the main one involved a â€œhe said, she saidâ€ situation. When I left the room one night, I returned to find my IPAD on the bedside table, with the screen smashed in. I went down, met with management, and was advised that the cleaning lady left a report that she had found it that way when she entered the room. I didnâ€™t take this news particularly well, given that I know the IPAD was fine when I left the room. I was promised another meeting the next day after the manager had talked to the cleaning lady. 

The next day the manager tried to avoid me, despite repeated attempts to talk to her. Finally I got her at reception. She gave me every excuse in the book â€“ â€œperhaps it fell off the table when I left the room.â€ Iâ€™m told I should have left it in the safe. Iâ€™m given a story about cameras.  Iâ€™m told that the cleaning lady is a valued employee, who has been at the hotel since it opened, and they believe her.  The bill for my two night stay ended up being close to 2000 Euros â€“ and Iâ€™m being told fairly rudely, that Iâ€™m a liar.  

Iâ€™m not somebody that deals with confrontation, I avoid it all costs â€“ and the last place I expect it is at a five star hotel, when Iâ€™m paying almost 2000 Euros for a two day escape. Anyways â€“ despite telling me she is the manager, eventually she sends me up the food chain to Hector â€“ who I guess is the real manager. Hectorâ€™s not at the hotel, so I send him an email, explaining the situation, and tell him, that Iâ€™m not particularly thrilled to be charged 1,958 Euroâ€™s for two nights, a lunch, and two massages â€“ and then be told by the manager that they believe the cleaning lady over the customer.  

The response from Hector only makes thing worse. He tells me that the previous person I dealt with handled the situation exactly the way she should, claims she never called me a liar, and tells me that while the price I paid for their services was considerable, I should consider the quality of the services.

Well Hector, in considering both the quality of the services, and the fact that your employee effectively called me a liar â€“ I believe your hotel is lousy. 

Your spa is terrible.  Itâ€™s tiny â€“ thereâ€™s one small change room for both sexes â€“ without a shower in it. The reception/sitting area is in the same room as the Jacuzzi â€“ so itâ€™s about 85 degrees and humid in there. The air conditioning was broken the day I was there. I was told by the masseuse that they were supposed to fix it, but hadnâ€™t gotten around to it.  You have two massage rooms â€“ only one of them has a tatami mat â€“ so when my wife and I both requested Thai Massages â€“ we were told weâ€™d start off in one room, then half way thru, weâ€™d switch rooms. In other words, half way thru the massage, we have to leave the room, wait ten minutes for them to clean the rooms, then we switch rooms and finish the massage. Not exactly relaxing â€“ especially when weâ€™re paying 135 Euros for the massage. 

At lunch at your hotel, I told the server I didnâ€™t like mushrooms, and asked if he could substitute a dish â€“ I was told no, I couldnâ€™t â€“ and in addition to that dish, three other dishes came with a mushroom broth. At the same lunch, I said Iâ€™d like to try a local white wine, and was rudely given three choices by a hurried waiter â€“ oaky, not oaky, or a little oaky â€“ as if they were the only considerations in white wine.

And management is appalling. If you have any kind of issue, expect a poor response. 

Iâ€™ve got a couple of young kids â€“ I donâ€™t get away as much as Iâ€™d like, or as much as I used to. The point of staying at expensive five-star hotels, is the notion that you will be taken care. Instead, I had my ipad smashed, dealt with confrontation, lost sleep, and had, what should have been a nice two day vacation ruined.  

Anybody staying at this hotel should reconsider â€“ there are plenty of other nice places, with much better locations, that Iâ€™m sure take care of their guests. Avoid this place at all costs.

Title: Spa is a joke
Text: We booked two Thai fusion massages at th Abac spa. When we arrived at the spa, you re told to change outside in a washroom. There is a tiny pool with two chairs in it, but they are right beside reception. Not exactly relaxing, and we didn't bring swimsuits. The steam room, which is a larger version of the personal shower ones, is also right beside reception with no walls in the extremely tiny place. The air conditioning was broken when we were there, so the room was extremely hot. nothing better than being covered in sweat for a massage. Then the masseuse, who was also the person at reception, told us there is only one room they can do Thai fusion in, so they made us have half the massage, get dressed, sit outside in the steamy hot room, and then finish the massage. Not an enjoyable or relaxing experience.

Title: Chic boutique hÃ´tel
Text:
A very nice 4 night stay here. Situated away from the main downtown areas near where the tram stars its climb to Tibidabo. Opposite taxi ranks, bus stops and underground links so travel easy. 2euro gets you a tube ride to central Barcelona, or about 8 or 9 euro by taxi. You can hop on/ off
the open top tourist bus which is a great way to get a perspective of the city's layout.
We stayed in the penthouse which was fun. You have to go through the kitchen to take the direct
route to the restaurant which affords a glimpse of the smooth running professionalism of the chefs, cooks and staff. No shouting here! We had the very simple continental breakfast served by
a charming lady who was very kind to us, and the receptionists, particularly Paloma were friendly and helpful with recommendations and bookings of various museums etc.
Just great

Title: Nice modern small hotel.
Text: Rooms were large and modern. Staff very friendly and helpful. Beds are a little firm for my taste. Great coffee shop and bakery across the street. They would exchange Dollars for Euros at fair price with no service charge.

Title: If you want a little peace and quiet but still be close to the heart of Barcelona, this is the place
Text:
ABac Barcelona is a very modern hotel located a little outside of the crazy hustle and bustle of the city. The staff is great and the rooms are large and comfy.  There is a wonderful bar and restaurant in ABaC for you to enjoy and head back upstairs.

This is the perfect place to stay if you want to go walk the Ramblas, but enjoy quiet most of the time

Title: very nice
Text:
All the reviews are right: perfect hotel, fantastic location, staff helpful...
comfortable room, very clean, not so near from the center but near to the tram and bus station, also you can reach easily the airport.
highly recommended,

Title: A quiet place conveniently central in Barcelona
Text:
On a recent stay in Barcelona we had five very comfortable nights at the ABaC.
Its location is just far enough from the inner city of Barcelona its airport and cruise terminal for some real peace and quiet.
Our room was open to natural light with electric curtains,extremely comfortable, clean and quiet.
The free wifi was fast and easy to connect with.
The hotel is right on the underground rail line, on a red hop on/off bus stop and the yellow one as well and across the road from a frequently utilised taxi stand.
All the staff were extremely helpful and spoke good English
The concierge managed to get us tickets to an FC Barcelona game during our stay which was an experience in itself - not to be missed on any visit to Barcelona
There are many small cafes within walking distance as well as a small quiet park adjacent to the hotel itself.
The included breakfast was sufficient and tasty.
We are unable to comment on the restaurant or spa as we did not utilise either during our stay however the restaurant was busy on all nights during our stay.

Title: Stunning, modern, perfect hotel.
Text: I stayed at the ABaC for a week with my fiance. The ABaC was and is the most modern and amazing hotels I've ever stayed in, and I have stayed at some amazing places. There are only a few rooms, making this place very exclusive. From the moment you enter your room, you feel like royalty, with 2 huge flat screens, a massive couch, the most comfortable bed i have ever slept in and a bathroom that will impress the pickiest travelers. It is a stones throw form the metro making getting around Barcelona a breeze. I would not even think about staying anywhere else. And the restaurant is in my top 3.

Title: Luxury
Text: We stayed for one night in a junior suite this summer. We knew the hotel from visiting their fantastic Michelin restaurant a few years back and were looking forward to a wonderful experience. Unfortunately, the restaurant is closed on Sundays, so we didn't get to enjoy it, but we were not disappointed with the rest of the hotel. The suite was 45 sqm of luxurious interior! The breakfast was as fantastic as expected (so was the room service). A quite expensive experience, but totally worth it - if not for the food or the interior, then maybe just to sleep in the best beds in Barcelona...

Title: A fabulous 5 star boutique hotel !
Text:
I don't know where to start from when I arrived it was an experience, I was offered a glass of cava with a hibiscus flower inside already I was in love , than brought to my room the room was spotless and absolutely beautiful from window treatments to the amazing bathroom , it's a open room concept and the shower was the best part it was a huge rainfall shower head , now it's only has 19 rooms so very small if you want loud and party central this is not for you , if your looking for romantic quite and the best food in Barcelona than this is your spot !!! 
The Resturant has 2 Michelin chefs need a say more ! Ugh from start to finish everyday the breakfast was the best thing ever the poached eggs to die for !!!!! Than the dinner hands done the best I've had thus far we did the tasting menu well worth the price is a once in a life opportunity the staff is wonderful and made us feel the whole 5 days like royalty I recommend this for couples and singles also small families with older children , I will be back for sure next year !!!!

Title: Gorgeous Hotel!
Text: I stayed at ABaC for 2 nights. It's a gorgeous place with all the amenities. The rooms are beautiful and modern. Each room comes with its own iPad, excellent wireless connection, refrigerator and mini bar. The beds are extremely comfortable with fine linens. The restaurant, although good, is expensive. Across the street is a delicious bakery with every type of croissant and baked good, fresh juices, etc. The location is good, but to get to main sites a taxi is needed.

Title: Fantastic Boutique Modern Hotel
Text: Staying here second time on our return trip to Barcelona, super friendly staff! Large spacious suites with all the modern conveniences, with beautiful shady terrace! Did not try the restaurant but have heard from numerous people that it is fantastic.

Title: Wonderful boutique hotel away from summer hoards
Text: I'm staying here at the moment, sitting in a supremely comfortable bed. The rooms are huge, the bathroom is larger than my college room. When we arrived here at 3.30am the other night, Roberto welcomed us very kindly. We slept like logs and groggily trudged downstairs to the outdoor deck within their discreet and verdant garden, and were welcomed with a beautiful breakfast. The pain au chocolat and other pastries were delights, the orange juice better than any I've tasted since I was in the south of france, the coffee perfect. The outlook from our room is onto the tibidabo hills. Had dinner at the 2-michelin starred restaurant last night and it was incredible, 155 euros pp - great value. A bit further from town than other joints, 10mins on the metro, but not at all a big deal. I will be back!

Title: Best hotel of our entire honeymoon
Text:
Sitting here trying to write this review it becomes obvious that it's hard to fully describe how wonderful everything is at ABaC. The hotel staff is warm and friendly, the grounds are absolutely gorgeous and the room is phenomenal. We booked the biggest suite they have and it is absolutely stunning. A rooftop room with a huge patio, an enormous bedroom and an awesome design. The room was comfortable, beautifully appointed and very romantic. We were extremely happy with it.

However, the room and service were dwarfed by the accomplishments of the kitchen. ABaC houses a 2 star Michelin restaurant and, needless to say, it is absolutely fantastic. The food is phenomenal, the service wonderful and having such an exceptional restaurant right in your hotel is a great experience. Even the in room dining is the best we've ever had. 

ABaC is fantastic overall. There are really no downsides to this place - it's small, it's beautiful, it's well appointed and the food is great. If you're in Barcelona I seriously cannot imagine another hotel competing on any front.

Title: Great experience!
Text: We stayed at ABaC for one night at both the first and  last leg of our trip to Southern France. ABaC sits on a very pretty street of beautiful homes and business establishments. Although the street is busy, our room was remarkably quiet. The subway was conveniently across the street. Our room was minimally but beautifully appointed, in keeping with the feeling of the spa services offered on the hotel's lower level. Quality mattress, pillows, and linens made for a good night's sleep. The bathroom was sleek and ultra-modern, with marble, and one-way mirrored doors separating the toilet and shower areas from the rest of the bathroom. The staff was friendly and very accommodating. We'll happily stay here again if a return visit to Barcelona is in the cards for us.

Title: What a fantastic little hotel
Text: The ABaC Hotel was fantastic.  It is right in the city, but in a fairly quiet area, and it is secluded behind a nice fence.  Once you get inside the gate, you are in a beautiful, quiet little world full of greenery outside.  The greeting when you check in is very nice, and then you are taken to your room.  Wow.  Great room with plenty of space, places to sit, a walk-in closet for your clothes and luggage, and everything is very modern, European style.  We asked for help in finding a small, simple local place for dinner and Christina was super-helpful in making some suggestions, then making a reservation for us, and giving us directions.  The included breakfast was extremely good, and was plenty to eat.  All of the help was excellent.  What an idyllic little spot!

Title: Elegant
Text: At first, I was disoriented by the gate for the hotel at the base of Avenida Tibidabo. When buzzed in, I entered a garden and a contemporary hotel. The service was outstanding. The room was one of the most tastefully designed hotel rooms I ever stayed in. You can take cabs to get around the city, but I suggest learning the Barcelona Metro system. The entrance is across the street from the hotel. This is a wonderful part of the city with many restaurants and stores. It is a great getaway from the bustle of La Rambla. This was a business trip - next time I'll go with my wife.

Title: A perfect getaway... Brilliant hotel
Text:
My wife and I rarely have any holidays, due to the hectic lives we have. We therefore only have one or two moments to briefly escape and disconnect from the family and business life. 

After researching hotels in Barcelona, I came across the ABAC Hotel and I loved the concept. I booked the Penthouse suite and, although we had a little administrative scare upon check-in (where we almost were moved to another smaller room) we utterly enjoyed our 3-day stay. 

The room is not the best feature of the Penthouse: the terrace is! A beautiful and private modern terrace with views to a public park and a great open air jacuzzi. The hotel staff is marvelous and attentive: breakfasts at our terrace became glorious and relaxing moments for us to unwind. For those techies, the AV of the room is marvelous, with a huge Bang & Olufsen system. 

The two-Michelin star restaurant deserves a separate review: it was a true jewel of gastronomy. Chef Jordi Cruz marveled us with unique dishes. 

Bravo to the ABAC Hotel, you deserve a standing ovation! We will make sure to recommend this venue to all of our friends travelling to Barcelona and we will see you again in the near future.

Title: Sophisticated retreat with designed ambiente
Text: Although away from Barcelonas busy center area this elegantly designed retreat gives you the perfect starting point to discover barcelona as taxi and bus station and metro are located around the corner. We enjoyed very much our personal terrace with stunning views at the Hotel and Hotel garden. Our room had elegantly designed furniture and bath, sometimes though not made for every-day use (dull light in shower and toilet).  The staff was friendly and open, the breakfeast is expensive but worth it -  although we preferred to enyou all sorts of pastry and a cortado in the bakeries in the center. We did not use pool nor the gym and did also not try the restaurant because it was fully booked. All in all, the ABaC is a sophisticated place to stay for couples who like to relax in a luxurious ambiente after a inspiring day in barcelona !

Title: Awesome
Text: Located away from the obvious spots in Barcelona, but with the convenience of public transport, taxi at the door and lots of small shops and markets around. This boutique hotel makes you feel like home with nice garden around and extremely courteous staff helping you all the time. The breakfast is expensive but worths try. The room is very contemporaneous decorated and surrounded with noise proof windows so you can stay longer pleasant time.

Title: Fantastic trip
Text: The staff were fantastic, the rooms were great and the pools were fantastic, Im a bit of a morning person and i love to get up and use the gym then go for a swim and quite often this can be a problem but not here, I had free reign to do exactly as a please at 6am which was great i could not recommend this more

Title: Book this 5 Star for a taste of Luxury
Text:
From the moment of our arrival, we knew this was something very special. We were greeted with a warm welcome and immediately given a tour of this splendid hotel. We were made to feel very much at home, made all the more so by walking through the open kitchen to get to our lift - this might at first seem unusual, however seeing how wonderfully the team worked and to be greeted every day, it is a lovely touch.

When we got to our suite we were speechless, the rain shower, Jacuzzi, kingsize bed (which had one of the most comfortable mattresses I have ever slept in - really), Nespresso coffee machine ... I could go on.  All wonderful.  

To top things off, we ate in the ABaC 2-star Michelin restaurant - we have experienced fine dining in the past, but boy, this knocks the spots off anything we've eaten before.  A culinary delight, with wonderful friendly staff who are so attentive.  Each course left us thinking "you can't do better than this" and, every time, the chefs managed to deliver on quality, excellence and mouth-watering flavors. 

Am currently sat on the sunny terrace with an aroma-filled coffee writing this review.  There's so much more I could add - the location is perfect, the hotel is within a stones throw of the tube and I'd highly recommend jumping on the tourist bus for the day, which you can book at reception and hop on just outside the hotel entrance. 

We also treated ourselves to a spa treatment - a 90 minute massage was a lovely stress buster to end our 4 night stay. Oh, and not forgetting to strongly recommend you try a Cava with a hibiscus flower, a first for me and won't be my last! 

All in all - I can't rate ABaC highly enough. If you're in Barcelona, this is the place to stay.

Title: 2 Star resturant 5 star service.
Text:
We travelled to Barcelona for a special occasion and werwe delighted with the service we recieved from this hotel. 

The meal was exceptional and facilities throughout this small and friendly hotel were very enjoyable.

For gin and tonic lovers they have 32 types of gin in the bar.

The open kitchen was a great touch and we enjoyed seeing service in full swing!

Title: Very nice hotel but a little pricey..
Text: We stayed in the ABAC for a long weekend. The hotel itself is fabulous, situated in one of Barcelona's most affluent neighbourhoods and removed from the madness of downtown Barcelona. The building is beautiful as are the rooms, service is world class, the staff are very friendly and helpful.The only gripe we had was with the charges for the minibar and the restaurant. While I have no problem paying a premium for a nice hotel, somewhere in the region of 6euros for a snail bottle of water is a bit much. Dinner for 2 in the restaurant came to 417 euro (although this did include a 100 euro bottle of wine). If it was in Paris I might be more forgiving but Barcelona is by no means an expensive city and having to check the price of things took the enjoyment away a little from what was an otherwise great hotel.

Title: AbaC Barcelona , Excellent Service, Fantastic Food , Very Personalised!
Text: Great Location!!! Excellent Food and Service (Personalised). Well worth the visit. The bed was exceptionally comfortable, room overlooking garden (peaceful). Easy to hop on Bus Turistic (Tour) stops at hotel door! hotel would be amazing if it had outdoor pool (pool is indoors). Staff go out of their way to please you. Well worth the visit.

Title: Exclusive stay in Barcelona
Text:
We stayed one night at ABaC and decided also to have dinner there in the evening. Both decisions turned out to be perfect for our short stay in Barcelona. The hotel is amazing and likely one of the best ones we ever stayed at. The personal are friendly, helpful and great. As we arrived by car, the fact that we could park in the underground garage and then walk straight up to the reception, was a nice feature too :-) We both like good food, and the standard at ABaC are really high, including the breakfast.
It is definitely a place we will return to.

Title: Friendly comfort and style with amazing food
Text:
We stayed in one of the suites for 4 nights.  It gave us somewhere to lounge about at the end of a long day in the city itself. The bed was incredibly comfortable and the bathroom,with huge shower and jacuzzi bath, was a pleasure to use.  Great soundproofing from the traffic noise.  
The staff were extremely helpful , booking tickets ahead to avoid queues, recommending other places to eat, pointing us in the right direction.
The tasting menu in the restaurant was a true experience.  Very innovative and we enjoyed sampling the Spanish produce.  The sommelier was very good and introduced us to a rather different form of pudding wine!
An extra touch is the spa  - a good massage was a must after tramping the streets.
ABaC is not bang in the centre but the underground is easy to use, taxis are plentiful and we did walk back from the centre in about 45 minutes.  
Overall a high quality oasis with fabulous staff and amazing food.

Title: Amazing comfort, great food, superb location
Text:
I stayed at the ABaC for 5 nights in January 2013, and loved it there. The hotel is amazing--it is small and so guests are well-looked after, and the rooms are so comfortable. The beds are like lying in a nest of feathers, and the black-out curtains ensured I woke up when I wanted to. The shower and bath are great too-- the shower is a rain drop shower, and the bath has chromatherapy (it changes colors of lights). 

Breakfast is a real treat-- I made sure to leave a couple hours to try every thing on the menu and feel relaxed through the process. 

There is a spa as well. I didn't have any of the treatments, but loved lounging in the jacuzzi and on the heated sun loungers, while drinking herbal tea. 

The hotel is located across the street from a train station, so getting into the city center is very easy and quick. The area itself is quiet and upscale, so you don't feel like you're right in the middle of it, but you're very close to everything you'd want to see while you were visiting Barcelona.

Title: Be prepared to have all your senses pampered
Text: The food is just beyond belief. The wine list is amazing and the wine expert is a real expert. The service is flawless. Go and Enjoy a real Gourmet experience. One of my top 3 ever. I reccomend you without any hesitation. All of this with such a young chef

Title: Hotel perfection
Text: A long weekend in Barcelona - best city brand in the world so very high expectations! The AbAC is a mix of old and new beautifully combined. The largest and most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. Room with a view of trees, lots of light, perfect decor. Rain shower, bath all good. Wonderfully helpful and friendly staff. Great advice from reception on where to go - even got us two old fogies in to city's trendiest cocktail and tapas bar. AbAC is an oasis of tranquility in this bustling city. It's about 50 metres from the Ave Tibidabo metro station so 10 mins from centre of town. A brilliant place to start from and it come back to. Also has bonus of being right next to the tram stop to go up to Mt Tibidabo for walks and views over the city. Outstanding hotel, brilliant location, great staff. Faultless.

Title: In a great neighborhood but overpriced
Text:
We recently stayed here while visiting family in Barcelona. While it is a nice facility, very well kept and in a quiet part of Barcelona, it is overpriced for what you get.
I would have to say the highlight of staying here is the rain shower in the bathroom which is unique to say the least. Staff is very friendly. We did not eat at the restaurant so I cannot know if the meal was worth the prices they post.
All in all there are hotels in downtown Barcelona that we have stayed at that are just as pricey but a better value all around.

Title: wonderful stay at ABAC Barcelona
Text: romantic and cozy location.metro 30 m , great restaurant Jordi Cruz , amazing sommelier and service.You can rent a bike and give a ride around the region or give a run at serra de coliserola.I will come back

Title: fantastic restaurant with excellent rooms
Text:
My family and I recently stayed for four nights at the ABaC and would have no hesitation in recommending the hotel and restaurant. The food was superb, having eaten the previous day at the Cellar can Rocca there was little to choose between the two in terms of quality, they were both lasting experiences.

The staff could not have been more helpful (football tackets arranged, advice as to sights to see and avoid!).

The rooms were equipped with all that one would need and were well soundproofed.

We are already looking forward to a return visit.

.

Title: Quite corner in City Break...
Text:
It was very nice, cute, romantic boutique hotel with a great restaurant and outside sitting area. We had an amazing food experience. Room we stayed was 208. Room was clean, bed is very comfy..(it was bad cos we didn't want to wake up:)  Points for feedback are:
* Lights in the room : Goes off or goes too bright altogether...control panels needs to be changed.
* TV :  TV quality was great but we had only 2 English Channels  and both were news.
*Bathroom : Water didn't drain totally..Water kept bursting hot and cold during the shower.

Title: perfect city escape for couples
Text: subway 20 meters, best sleep ever, ever didn't want to leave your hotel bed? roberto's city map stabilo instruction top notch, very charming staff, stylish and super quite rooms, barcelona for ever, properly the best escape ever.

Title: Some of the best food in Europe
Text:
We did not stay at ABaC but ate at their signature restaraunt.

Without a doubt; some of the best food Europe has to offer.   Exception in every sense of the word; the tastes are inspired, the delicacy of each dish does not go unnoticed and even with the hefty price tag I would go back again if I ever return to Barcelona.

This is a 'once in a lifetime' dinner.   Make sure you do it once in your lifetime.

Title: A Hidden Gem
Text: This luxurious boutique hotel is easy to overlook because it is located in a quiet residential neighborhood rather than in the center of the city, which turns out to be a big plus. The neighborhood is utterly charming and only a quick taxi or metro ride (taxi stand and metro station both across the street) to all the main attractions. Our king room was very spacious and included a separate seating area easily closed off with pocket doors, double closets and a plush bathroom, although I agree with a previous reviewer, it's way too dimly lit. Everyone on the staff, was attentive, very helpful and extremely professional. Special thanks to hotel manager, Marien, and Roberto.You met our every need, and promptly at that.  We recommend this excellent hotel to anyone visiting Barcelona, whether for a 1st trip or return visit.

Title: Excelent but not perfect.
Text:
The idea of an ipad at the room was very good. The arrival was not excelent. Our luggage was not picked up at the entrance and the service level was not as good as other same level hotels.
The restaurant was excellent and deserves the 2 stars.

The Lady at breakfast was a little strange. Trying to be friendly but a little professionalism more should improve overall quality.

The room was very confortable and silent. A enormous giratory Bang & Olufsen tv is opulent but not very user friendly. The remote control is confusing as well as the tv's software.

The toilet zone at the bathroom has extremely low light.

The material used in the bathroom construction or lighting when cooling makes some sound (a little disturbing cliks)

As you can see my comments are small things which are easily solved. Anyway the hotel was excellent.

Title: The evening was a culinary gold medal winning marathon of Olympic standards
Text:
We were in the Restaurant in a party of 50 for a pre wedding dinner.
From the moment we arrived the understated service confidence and professionalism of all involved was immediately apparent. We loved the stylish garden and enjoyed a per dinner drink.
The restaurant itself is a joy with well spaced tables allowing plenty of space for audible conversation.
The meal was an absolute delight with culinary surprises, tastes that challenged and lifted the pallet. Course upon course served quietly, efficiently and professionally.
I have no idea of cost.Â Style confidence and stunning food and service. Highly recommended, the only other restaurant where i have dined that could hold a candle to it is Le Petit Nice in Marseilles. Both well worth visiting.

Title: Gastronomical Luxury
Text:
We chose this hotel because of the reputation of it's restaurant. We were not disappointed. The 14 course tasting dinner was phenomenal. The wait staff were so attentive. Ratio of staff to guests is nearly 1:1. Front desk staff knew who we were by name and were very helpful at all times. There was a fire in the hotel 48 hrs before our arrival. The smell of smoke was noticeable in our room, but the hotel provided us with a filter which worked exceptionally well.
Bathroom was a bit of a disappointment. Shower was small with unusual drain which did leak onto the bathroom floor, however the rooms are well appointed and soundproof.

Title: Yes, Yes, Yes...
Text: Excellent hotel, location, staff, spa, and service! Oh, and Jordi Cruz runs the restaurant! We will return to Barcelona and when we do, we will return to the ABaC. Our meal at the restaurant was a memory, indeed. Go there and do that!

Title: Great hotel
Text:
Stayed here for 5 days in September, and was extremely impressed; great staff, rooms, and food.

Stayed in a deluxe room, spacious, quiet and modern. Excellent huge bathroom, with great rain shower. Very impressed that manager showed us to our room, and explained all the quirks of the lighting, curtains etc.

Staff overall were exceptional, great attention to detail. On check in, we were given a map, and guided through all the sites of the city and how to get there. Really impressed also by the lady in charge of breakfast. She was very warm, and almost motherly, and i have to say she served the best breakfast/brunch i have had in a long time. The egg speciality is pretty impressive.

Ate in the restaurant one of the nights, and it was spectacular, well worth a detour! Again, great personal service, explanation of the courses and good wine. Chef here worth at least two stars.

Location is ideal if you want a hotel in city centre, but slightly away from crowds of tourists. It's about 10-15 mins by metro/rail to placa de catalunya. Also there are some great eateries near the hotel, and some unusual ones! 

Overall, i couldn't recommend this hotel enough, ideal for short to long breaks, and you should definitely eat at the restaurant once. It is an experience not to be missed

Title: Have to aCT
Text:
Well, we had chosen this hotel because we thought we wanted to have a treat before to head back home,with it's michelin fame,it's location,and it's sleek design,it's sounded perfect,but
A.
A Gourmet Treat
With it's 12courses ABaC menu,seem like a joke,it's all served in what we called a spirit house portion,too small of a portion,and not so good of what you've expected as for the level of the restaurant of this fame and categories.
The waiter are not very professional,I mean ,they just slide  the dishes on to your table just like they did when they return the empty dishes back to the kitchen,perhaps it's  a sunday night and they wanted to get it done as soon as possible.
B.
Being born as a restaurant 
They seem to understand also the need of accommodation,but on doing so,it should be automatically  give a priority to the guests who've booked the room there,doesn't matter if they going to spend the evening there or not,but considered the fact that it's some distance from the centre and the michelin fame,it would be enough to underline the fact that 's why we've chosen to stay there.
For us ,it's been a few hours before the table is confirmed,and only in the outside terrace,which perhaps is supposed to be for the waiting listed or un important guested?Of the way the waiter treated us,we guess it is.
aC
I must say the breakfast is very good(my husband got sicked,after the famous 12courses menu,and taking only immodium in the next 2 days,so it's only me for breakfast)and as well as the club sandwich,it's the most delicious I ever had,So,you started to think it could be a mistake or  sadly a mis management ? I mean,the room are  comfortable and functional,as well as the sleek designed,well located,for someone who look for a tranquility, the restaurant  have to aCt differently in order to keep up with the good reviews that they've got and with them good intention and understanding they will reach only to the top!!!

Title: Wonderful foodie experience, luxurious rooms
Text: I stayed here for my 40th birthday and loved every minute of it. Friendly staff, michelin restaurant, wonderful room equiped with the latest high tech, amazing bedding slept like a princess. We had breakfast just across the street (bakery) with lovely bread, cakes, ,,,, sweet and savoury.  Bus stop in front of the door. If you like strolling around during the night time there is little to see ... So we combined this hotel with hotel ohm .... Location ohm hotel but overall comfort and food experience 10/10 for Abac.

Title: Beautiful, Elegant Hotel with Amazing Food
Text:
We stayed at the ABaC in August 2012 for two nights.  From the moment we arrived, the staff was enormously helpful and kind.  We arrived from the airport very early in the morning, yet they were still able to check us into our room right away.  Christina at the front desk was a huge help in getting us settled and providing tips on where to travel around the city.  Everyone - across the board - was incredibly friendly.  Overall, it was a lovely experience and we highly recommend staying at the ABaC.  Some details:

The Room
Our hotel room was situated in the "new" section of the ABaC building. Not too big and not too small, it was beautifully appointed and outfitted with luxury amenities.  The best way to describe the aesthetic is calming, quiet and comfortably (not cold) modern.  The hotel itself is very peaceful and quiet. I never saw any other guests, but the hotel was fully booked.  If you're looking for something more active, this is not the place for you.  However, if you're looking for a peaceful sanctuary, this is the perfect retreat.  

The Location
While the hotel is not in the traditional center of the city, we found it very easy to navigate to areas like Las Ramblas, Bari Gothic, the Born and the waterfront by using the Barcelona subway, which was located less than two blocks from the hotel. Truthfully, we liked escaping the hectic, touristy areas to retreat back to the hotel.  We didn't see this as a disadvantage, but for those who want action right outside their hotel - ABaC would not be the right choice.

The Restaurant
Amazing.  Really, not much more to say than that.  You will pay handsomely for your 14-course meal, but it will be worth every euro.  We loved our experience - and it was an experience from the moment you sat down to the moment you left.  Attentive, charming service and food that genuinely knocks your socks off. We loved it.

We chose originally chose ABaC for its small size and for the restaurant.  We wanted a unique experience in a small boutique hotel and ABaC delivered that for us.  We had a wonderful time and would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Title: Best design & service hotel.
Text: From the moment you are welcomed to the hotel, the amazing room complimented by the personal service. Look out for Pillar who serves the best breakfast with a genuine smile, just like your mum. The rooms are very well designed for comfort as well and functionality. The front desk are some of the most helpful staff I have met, especially as I lost my I phone and they pulled out all the stops to help me find it

Title: Loved it!
Text:
We spent 3 nights here in January- it was perfect from start to finish.
I booked a car transfer with the hotel and a smart uniformed driver was waiting for us at the airport. The check in was very efficient and Marien showed us around the hotel and explained all the gadgets in our suite. 
We were in room 824- fabulous room, it was the best few nights sleep we have ever had!
The restaurant was amazing- relaxed, friendly, great sommelier, food was out of this world. Without doubt the best restaurant we have ever eaten in. And being able to watch the chefs at work in the kitchen was a wonderful experience. 
Breakfast was innovative and different, and a relaxing experience, which is often not the case.
Marien and the team could not do enough for us- they were so friendly and helpful.  
The hotel is just across the road from a metro station, taxi rank and tourist bus stop- very good links to the city centre. 
Would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Barcelona.

Title: my dream urban hotel
Text: My second time at Abac and again everything was perfect!! If all chic urban hotels could be this outstanding by making me feel like the star in my 'own home'. Their names have been mentioned in other reviews but that is for a reason! Marien and Pilar really really make your stay so incredibly enjoyable. I was upgraded to a gorgeous suite and Pilar took care of my lovely breakfast. This exceptionally designed hotel is in a beautiful green area of Barcelona and not near the main attractions but taxis are always around the corner and the metro (stop across the street from the Abac) takes you to Placa Catalunya in 10 mins flat. On my third visit I plan to eat in their fabulous restaurant. See you soon Marien and Pilar!!

Title: Best urban hotel in Spain
Text: We came back to Abac, after three years, and we found everything perfect. Again we stayed at room 812, which enjoys a beatiful terrace. My wife also enjoyed the spa, which is small but really chic. Special greetings to Pilar, the women in charge of breakfast, who makes you feel like at home. And the rest of the staff is simply fantastic. In my view, Abac is the best urban hotel in Spain.

Title: Outstanding service
Text: Most enjoyable stay, great room and all the staffs in the hotel are very friendly and accommodating. Highly recommended to try the restaurant in the hotel - it will be one of the best meals you ever had.

Title: A Memorable Luxurious Stay
Text:
My husband and I were looking for a quiet but conveniently located hotel with luxurious amenities to spend our week in Barcelona. ABaC a luxury boutique hotel far exceeded our expectations. The hotel staff were very friendly and looked into all our needs promptly by booking tickets for popular sights, recommending places to visit, dine and chill. Our room overlooked lush greenery which was very soothing to wake up to in the mornings. I just loved the bed and bedding the best. You could just sink into the bed after a long day out and have a very restful and peaceful night. The shower and mood lighting was also amazing and modern. 
And finally I would like to recommend the ABaC Restaurant. You should go for the degustation menu. We were serenaded with the most exotic flavours throughout the evening, and cava and  wines to match. It was indeed a very memorable experience. Thanks to the very professional and friendly staff.

Title: Outstanding, no words
Text: My best experience in an hotel from all the trips i have done, Little but comfortable  spa ( the two times we used it there was all of it for us, prÃ­vate spa jajaj, I suppose because there are very few rooms) as far as I remember the spa has vapor sauna, cold water pool, jacuzzi hot water( sort of beds inside the jacuzzi, very nice) and great massages, spa out of charge fOr all guests. U got to try the restaurant, its expensive but it totally worths it, creative and delicious food. It is located in residential zone, u have very near tibidabo and it is like u where living in barcelona and just at the entrance of the hotel u got underground starion and taxi station and u will be in the city center in mÃ¡ximum 10 minutes. Absolutely  recommendable

Title: A great new year's eve to remember
Text: We went there to celebrate New Year's eve and my son's birthday and that was an unforgettable night. The staff was most helpful and courteous, food and drinks were far beyond anything that one could wish, so were the music and the decorations. The hotel is far from the crowded centre and provides an ultimate intimacy and enough space for feeling at home.

Title: Quality, luxury and comfort
Text: This ultra modern hotel is conveniently located near a metro station (just across the street). Located in a neighborhood, away from the main tourist area which was not a big deal for us since we had a car and with the metro being so close. The neighborhood does not have many restaurants, but there is a nice bakery/cafe across the street that makes excellent cappuccinos, bread, croissants, pastries, and ready made sandwiches.  Although the hotel offers breakfast with a nice selection of breakfast items, we preferred the cafe across the street for having coffee, croissants and fresh squeezed OJ every morning. There are also several small markets within a 5 minute walk for picking up fruit, wine, gourmet goodies, etc. I would HIGHLY recommend making a reservation for dinner at the hotel restaurant. It's a bit pricey, but well worth the experience.  There is seating available inside or outside on the garden patio. Although the patio garden is a beautiful setting, I would advise sitting inside due to loud traffic noise that somewhat distracted from the whole culinary experience. Also, we did get surprised by a rain shower later in the evening and had to be moved inside to finish our dessert course. Our room was very quiet despite the fact it was facing a busy street.  The accommodations are quite modern with tastefully appointed, generously sized rooms and bathrooms. The bed and down filled pillows were very comfortable and dressed in quality bed linens. The hotel is very private and secure with several gated entrances and a gated underground garage. Most importantly the staff was extremely nice and very helpful.

Title: Amazing in every way possible
Text: Booked 2 rooms, the deluxe and the superior. Superior had a nice size terrace. Upon arrival, we were met by 2 bellmen who took our baggage and escorted us upstairs to check-in. This hotel has only 15 rooms. The staff were personable and worked hard to make sure that we were taken care of. The hotel is housed in the former location of the United States embassy, which is why the location is so secluded. The hotel is not in the center of Barcelona, but PlaÃ§a Catalunya and the city center are a 5 minute metro or taxi ride away. Rooms were stylish and neat and the hotel is very contemporary. Breakfast does not have a huge variety, but it does suffice. Everything that comes out of that kitchen is handmade from scratch. Make sure to have dinner at the Restaurant. Having been to Barcelona three times, this hotel has been one the best I've ever had the pleasure of staying in. Their website has many pictures and information that helped us choose it. Amazing Amazing Amazing!

Title: Worth it if you've got the money
Text:
Let's get two things out of the way. 1. This hotel is not, by any stretch of the imagination, cheap. 2. It is not in the centre of Barcelona. If you can cope with the short tube or taxi journey, and want to support the Spanish economy, it's a great, stylish choice.

The hotel is in a modern, apparently purpose-built building, in 2 distinct blocks, and also houses a Michelin starred restaurant. This review refers to the hotel only and not the restaurant. We had a warm welcome from the staff (who appeared slightly amazed we didn't need help with our luggae; clearly we were under-baggaged by their well-heeled standards, but really, who needs more than a rucksack for a sunny weekend away?). There was a welcome glass of Cava while they explained a little about the city and gave us a map, making recommendations about where we should go when they heard it was our first time in Barcelona. All of their recommendations that we had time to try, e.g. where to get good paella, were worthwhile. One especially good piece of service was that they recommended booking online for La Sagrada Familia (i.e. the Gaudi church) and even booked online for us and printed out the tickets at no cost. We were able to waltz past the enormous queue and go straight in. It would have beenworth going just for the pleasure of walking past the queue!

We were walked up to our room and the lighting system was explained to us (valuable; saved us that game of "hunt the lightswitch" which you often end up having to play at bedtime in hotels). The room was spacious, stylish and comfortable, with lovely Hermes toiletries and a funky square sink that was actually functional. The one-way mirrored glass in the toilet door was a bit disconcerting, mind. Although the hotel is in quite a noisy location, by a major roundabout, the glazing and curtains were effective, giving us a quiet, dark room and a very comfortable two night's sleep.

Breakfast was delicious; we got fresh orange juice, a really nice bowl of fruit with basil granita, posh yoghurts, breads & pastries, a Jamon Iberico sandwich and a wonderful slow-poached egg (with a tiny bit of parmesan-y mashed potato; cheffy, but nicer for breakfast than you'd think). It did seem to be one of those hotels where you worry they are fattening you up for medical experimentation - two full-sized chocolate bars each placed on the pillow wasn't quite what I was after as a bed time snack after the 7 course tasting menu (we took 'em home though).

There is a cavernous bar in the basement where they do a good range of cocktails and spirits; there's also a walled garden area for drinks or breakfast, which is a luxury, albeit a traffic-noise-disturbed luxury, in a city hotel.

Title: Brilliant little gem
Text: We visited this beautiful boutique hotel last Sept and I am sorry this review was not written sooner. We arrived around 8.00am and we were upgraded to a larger room than we had booked and our room was ready for us straight away and no need to wait around for checkin so this was greatly appreciated. Staff were friendly and helpful in explaining the features of the hotel. The hotel was quiet and we did not experience any noise with regards to traffic or within the hotel itself. The wow factor for us was the rainshower, bathroom, bang &olfsen and in general everything about the room. Breakfast was amazingly good with handmade breads, sweet pastries and an unusual take on bacon and eggs. No one does hams and bacon better than the Spanish. Location was perfect for us as the tourist bus stop was right out the front and we used this everyday while in Barcelona. Taxis are always available but beware as we were stung with an excessive taxi fare from the port to the hotel. If in doubt about the fare ask for a reciept! We did not use the spa as we were limited to only a few days here. The only big disppointment for us was that coming all the way from Australia we missed out on dining at the main restaurant as this was closed on both our nights there. We would have loved to see that restaurant open 7 nights a week, but we had the meal of our lives at Montiels Restaurant located very close to the Picasso museum. The grounds at the ABAC are beautiful and a serene place to sit and sip a glass of very good Spanish wines after the maddening crowds at La Rambla. Overall we loved our a time at this brilliant little gem and the fantastic staff and for a good price too made our trip to Barcelona memorable.

Title: A design hotel with lots of good features
Text: We spent 2 nighs and were upgrated to a room with a terrace. very nice room very quiet inside but no way to spend time in the lovelly terrace...far too noisy because of cars. The hotel is a bit far from the center but in Barcelona you find taxis anytime everywhere. worst thing was the breakfeast. in a hotel with a 2 michelin restaurant you expect more than some terrible Danish pastries and croissants obviously industrial. the service was extremely helpfull very nice decoration and confortanle bed and a top diner at the restaurant.

Title: A gastronomic delight
Text:
Wow. I stayed here with some colleagues for 1 night on a business trip, and we were simply amazed.

The staff were polite, attentive, and personable, the rooms contemporary, comfortable, and well equipped (bang & olufson tv's, rain shower, jacuzzi tub), and the restaurant simply amazing.

I cannot say enough good things about the restaurant.  I am fortunate enough to have eaten in quite a few Michelin starred restaurants over the years, and so have a reasonable sense of what to expect; but the meal here was off the chart, simply the best dining experience I've ever had, anywhere, and that is saying something.

If I was to try and be super critical and find faults, then I'd maybe say that the corridors approaching the bedrooms are not to the standard of the rest of the hotel, the bedroom doors lack privacy locks or "do not disturbe" signs, and it could do with a gym.  But these did not take away from this being a fantastic experience for me.

Title: Fantastic
Text:
I came here with my partner as part of a special long weekend break with friends. The location is out of the way and therefore secluded & peaceful. Had we been coming just for sightseeing we would have stayed more centrally but this was not the point of the trip.

We were greeted warmly on arrival by a lovely concierge/manager who was a warm & friendly Spanish lady - with a glass of lovely cava. Our room was not massive but very well appointed with a massive balcony overlooking the park. 

From the hotel it is easy to access taxis to all the sights - Parc Guell is nearby.

The breakfast was fantastic and included in our rate ( with American Express) - served by a lovely, kind and genuine lady - Pilar. 

We had the tasting menu for lunch with our group on Saturday lunchime - 14 courses inc appetizers - and 4 hours of very upmarket courses with carefully matched wine in great company - a really unusual and fun experience.

Reception were very helpful in checking us in online for our onward flight - the service throughout was absolutely impeccable.

This was a very unusual experience for me - totally intimate & luxurious - this is an expensive location but it is justified by the whole ambiance

Title: Great retreat
Text:
I spent two nights at AbaC during my recent trip to Barcelona after 3 nights at the Mandarin Oriental. Got a good rate from a hotel site, hence decided to give it a try.  Besides, I knew the restaurant is top rate.  Must say that I am glad I did.  The hotel is in a quiet residential area at Av Tibidabo.  So no shops around, but if you want to get away noise of the city, it's a good retreat.  Rooms are comfortable and nicely designed.  The bathroom is really cool:  a jacuzzi tub with mood lighting and separate showers and a one way glass mirror through which one can look into the bedroom (but not the other way).  Service is friendly and personal.  Although she speaks little English, the lady who serves breakfast every morning is so sweet.  Food is superb:  both creative and tasty. I suggest going for the tasting menu.

I probably wouldn't recommend this to someone who's in Barcelona for the first time because of the location.  But if you know Barcelona a fair bit and love food, this is the place.

Title: Not worth it
Text:
Just arrived from a 4 night stay. It is a very good hotel, but other 5 star hotels are better. We were the only couple there, on the 2nd day another couple arrived. There is no fitness area, so there's nothing to do except use the spa. The prices of food are ridiculously expensive so I suggest you take a cab and find a good restaurant. It's a very small hotel, away from the city centre. I booked this hotel because all the other 5 star hotels were fully booked. It's nothing compared to El palace hotel, which is in the centre. Once you've experienced El Palace, you cannot enjoy your stay anywhere else. 

The staff was excellent at ABaC, very professional especially the breakfast blonde lady. She's amazingly genuine. Wherever you go you need to take a cab, it's 10 minutes away from the centre.

Title: Celebrating BD =))))
Text:
I agree with the reviews above about the hotel and accommodation and just want to add that its a really nice place I have found near the hotel - its a night disco called as Atlantic Disco.
I made surprise for my couple to celebrate her Birthday with our friends))) She was extremely happy and liked the evening there! Everything was amazing! We do love it!

Title: The perfect relaxing weekend retreat in Barcelona
Text:
My wife and I had the pleasure of being looked after by the team at ABaC in March 2012. Everything about our stay was absolutely perfect, from the warmest of welcomes, through pampering spa treatments to the exquisite food.
ABac really is an oasis of calm and relaxation to which we found ourselves retreating several times a day from the hustle and bustle of the city. 
Oh, and Marien ... you are an angel!
The Norwegians.

Title: The best you can do in Europe trousers on!
Text:
ABaC is a really good hotel, if you like ambient, relaxing atmosphere and good food since it is also two Michelin stars restaurant. It must be the best hotel in Barcelona, and one of the best in Europe.

ABaC is actually a villa located in Avenguida Tibidabo where the most prestigious houses in Barcelona are. This is far from where tourists typically flock. On the other hand hop-on & hop-off bus stops just in front of the hotel, if you want to join. Tibidabo mountain and church visible for all Barcelona is tram and funicular trip away. You can get to Plaza Catalonia by metro, which station is 50 meters from hotel.

Rooms are big, well-equipped (Bang&Olufssen LCD-screen and DVD, remote controlled curtains, remote controlled lights, both jacuzzi and shower in bathroom, etc.) and stylish. Since there are not so many rooms, it's very quiet. Public spaces are extremely comfortable, and service is the absolute best you can get in Europe. I consider it extreme good value for money.

If you are looking for romantic weekend in relaxing atmosphere, take a room and book a table in the restaurant. This is the best thing you can do in Europe trousers on!

Title: Wonderfully accurate reviews!
Text:
I rely heavily on the opinions of trip advisor to plan my stays. When I saw all of the positive feedback on this small boutique hotel I knew I had to try it. The reviews were accurate, to say the least. 

The small hotel (15 rooms) is wonderfully appointed, in a really lovely neighborhood, steps away from public transportation but a really nice walk to many places. The staff members focus on the guests, showing the details of the hotel and making sure your needs are met - even before you arrive. They know who you are (including the bar tender whom I had never seen before!) and they take pride in making sure you want for nothing.

I was there on a Monday so I knew I would not be able to try the restaurant, but I plan to return with my husband and we will make a reservation. 

I travel a lot, and stay in many hotels. When I returned, I told my husband that ABaC was one of the nicest hotel experiences I have had. It was a combination of the really lovely hotel, the service, the amenities....  I really liked the rain shower, although it is a little challenging (in the room type I as in) to open the shower, turn on the water to get warm and not get the water all of the floor. Not an issue for me, but I thought I would point that out.

Barcelona is one of my favorite cities and I love to visit. I am so glad that I have found the right hotel, and will go back again. 

This hotel deserves each of the 5 stars.

Title: Wonderful setting and very relaxing.
Text: As a frequent visitor to Barcelona on business and pleasure I try to stay at different hotels and Abac is one of the best. During my recent stay I was very impressed with the service, the rooms were outstanding and the restaurant was excellent. They have an extensive wine list and the setting is very relaxing. Despite the fact that it is not in the heart of Barcelona, it was not a problem as there is a subway stop across the street and cabs go by frequently. Highly recommend Abac for business or pleasure.

Title: I like this place
Text:
For those of you who already know Barcelona, or/and don't need/ want to be right in the centre, this is a first class choice.

It's a 10 minute taxi ride down to the centre, say 15 minutes to Barceloneletta.

Well run and comfortable, apart from some late night room service problems, we had no complaints at all.

Title: Interesting design hotel at the top of Barcelona
Text:
We loved being at the top of the city, right at a subway stop, at this beautiful hotel.  We had the Penthouse Suite and a regular room for our kids.  The Penthouse was very beautiful and perfectly appointed with expansive bath, outdoor jacuzzi and hughe terrace with multiple sitting areas.

We stay in many fine hotels, but the price of food here took your breath away.  Perhaps better for couples as oppose to a family with two teenage boys.

That being said, the food was amazing, the staff friendly and helpful and the location great.

Title: Wonderful, private ABaC; perfect weekend away
Text:
From being buzzed in to our departure we were treated to exemplary service in stunningly contemporary and private surroundings.  The staff took time to explain everything and even gave us a detailed itinerary of the best places to visit and the best times to go.  There are only 15 rooms in this boutique style hotel, so personal service is second nature to everyone involved.  You are assured of your privacy as the lifts work by your key and access to the bedroom levels are denied to anyone not having a key.  Our room (we had a suite) had two Bang & Olufsen tvs, an iPad, a jacuzzi bath and rainfall shower.  Rooms were spotlessly clean and the turndown service offered wonderful bars of chocolate each night. All the rooms are totally soundproof and provided an excellent night's sleep. The 2* Michelin restaurant was out of this world (I will write a separate review) but accommodates guests and locals choose to visit as well.

The tiny, intimate spa provided me with a wonderful Elemis massage and facial, and prices consistent with a top hotel.  Highly recommended.

The hotel is situated at the end of Line 7, and the metro is clean, fast (11 minutes to the centre of Barcelona) and ran to time throughout our stay.  Buy a T10 ticket and share it between the two of you; this is perfect for a weekend and works out cheaper than individual tickets. Taxis are prolific just outside the metro station, which is a one minute walk from the hotel.

This is not a cheap hotel (member of Small Luxury Hotels of the World) but it is worth every penny.  It certainly suited us as a quieter romantic base, yet within touching distance of the bright lights of Barcelona.

Title: Wonderful out of the way romantic getaway, but IN Barcelona!
Text:
We stayed at the ABaC Hotel from shortly after Christmas through the early New Year (Jan 4, 2012), and found the staff sincerely happy about where they work, extremely hardworking, and all willing go out of their way to please their guests (and indeed made our stay as comfortable and restful as possible).  From their AWESOME manager, Marien Inigo-Schneider (she is ALL about aiming to please, will not put up with incompetence and, I suspect, never sleeps!), to their front desk staff (Christina and other very capable and helpful colleagues), to the young, 2-Michelin Star chef, Jordi Cruz (a guest hallway runs right through the ABaC kitchen where you can witness this amazing restaurant in action and say hello to Jordi himself!), THIS is the hotel to stay in Barcelona.  

While this place is a short cab ride away from downtown Barcelona, take the Metro -- it is cheap, clean, safe, quick and enjoyable.  Both the taxi stand and station are right across the street from the hotel.  As for noise, there is none: ALL the windows are soundproof at the hotel, and you don't hear a sound from a minimal amount of traffic that runs by the hotel (the hotel itself is located in a nice, residential area of Barcelona).

While there were some issues with the hotel being a bit too modern for its own sake (limited individual light controls, slightly complicated TV system, and some suite layouts have the bedroom before the living room area such that room service becomes somewhat awkward if you want to stay in the "privacy" of your own bed), this hotel is excellent, and I would highly recommend it to anyone seeking to stay in Barcelona.  LOTS of hidden and well placed closet and drawer space so as not to leave you stressing over having a room with luggage laying around.  NOTE:  you must ask for "hand towels" if you want washcloths (it's a language issue, I think), and for a full pot of coffee (not hot water to dilute the strong coffee provided) if you are a big coffee drinker.
