In short, they were GREAT at meeting our many requests and attempting to understand "American" oddities (such as the large pots of strong coffee). 

We will definitely go there again!!!  :-)

Title: A perfect stay at Abac !
Text:
Just had a perfect 2 night stay,smiling and efficient staff  during all our stay, penthouse was fabulous with huge terrace with a lot of outside furniture and outside shower , room was full of light, with a view from everywhere, including the  shower,+ enjoying sunrise from the bed at the touch of a button commanding the curtains, very clever design in bathroom + dressing.
A minor problem was efficiently solved by the Guest Manager Marien, breakfast was good (not exceptional ) but the lady in charge of the breakfast took excellent care of us .
We had Room service once and both (simple) dishes were perfect.
The Spa is very relaxing and the massage was simply the best ever (by Lucie or Lucy ?) , and I had Banyan, Aman and Como before. 
When you ge back to the Hotel you can either pass through reception , or via another entrance directly to the room, you fell like if you are living in Barcelona.
I didn't like the rainshower in the bathroom, I think it is nice as an addition to a "real " shower , but it can't replace the feeling of a " power shower ".
  Can't wait to go back to Abac Barcelona !

Title: Restaurant visit and Service of staff
Text:
Unfortunately my family and I could not stay at the property due to needing to cater for our 15 month old son, however we had lunch in the restaurant.
There was an initial error made by the hotel for the booking, but it was later corrected in a manner that exceptional.
Once given the opportunity to correct their mistake, I can only say that the service and standards that this hotel displays is literally second to none. The elegance of the staff and overall property is a benchmark that other hotels should look to.
The restaurant has recently earned 2 stars from Michelin. This is without a doubt the best food experience my wife and I have ever had. We dined exactly 3 weeks after eating in Daniel, a 3 star restaurant in New York. There was no comparison. Whilst Daniel was amazing, the service, imagination of the chef and everything that the restaurant surparsed Daniel.
The flavours and imagination of the dishes are extrodonary. The food was art in every sense of the word. The chef...a genius. He will soon be recognised as one of the worlds best - I am certain of it.
There are other words I am sure to describe this restaurant, but still a few days after visiting, I am lost for them.
Make one of your afternoons or evenings a visit to this restaurant - treat it as an attraction and experience that you can rarely get in other places around the world.

Title: Gorgeous Boutique Hotel with Excellent Service
Text:
A super modern hotel with luxurious touches such as Bang and Olufsen electronics, Hermes products, and there even is a cartridge coffee maker in the room. Since the hotel premise was locked, we actually had difficulty checking in at 1300. This was due to a malfunction of the doorbell at both entrances. The staff were super apologetic about the incident and from there our stay was good. We stayed in the Superior Room with our own large private balcony. The balcony square footage might have been bigger than the room itself. The bathroom had a separate bath with rain shower. And when I say rain shower I mean a 2 ft x 2 ft gush of water coming down from the ceiling! We did have some difficulty figuring out how to adjust the temperature, but once that was resolved it was heaven.

We ate at the newly upgraded 2 Michelin star restaurant and it was absolutely divine. I have eaten at many Michelin rated restaurants, including the 3 star Per Se in New York and the ABAC restaurant might have been out best dining experience ever. In addition to the whimsical delicious food, the restaurant was able to fully accommodate my girlfriend's dietary restrictions.

We only had one minor gripe that ironically has to do with the heavy sound-proofing of the hotel. The heavy and numerous doors that it takes to get to your room really isolate the sound well, however, they slam and make a loud noise after each one is opened. This means that when another guest leaves their room, especially with at an adjacent floor, we hear every door slam on their way out. I don't know how much the hotel can do to fix this but again it's just a minor detail.

All in all we had a wonderful stay and we will definitely be back to the ABAC for both the stay, the warm, friendly, excellent staff, and the food.

Title: Excellent hotel. Awesome staff.
Text:
I stayed at ABACat the end of September for 6 days and although this review is a little late I think it is worth mentioning how wondering the experience of staying there was. I left thinking that, service is excellent, hotel is unique, small but comfortable, luxurious, quiet and location, convenient and peaceful. Truly a modern boutique hotel with an excellent restaurant and awesome and attentive staff.

SERVICE

I have to praise Marien and her team. She made us feel so welcomed from the moment we stepped foot into ABAC. We really appreciate the awesome restuarant recommendations that was provided as the suggested places for local food were excellent choices. Also, they will highlight all the `must visit' places for which I found 6 days was not enough. For information, you can approach anyone of their staff and rest assured, they will try their best to accede to your request.

Turn down service is always prompt and housekeeping is had been consistent throughout the 6 days spent. Hermes amenities are used and for added touch of detail, his and hers amenity boxes are provided.

ROOMS

The deluxe room we had was spacious. Had separate walk in closets and bath areas. Lighting is automated so if there is movement in the room, you will have lights on. Best part of it, there are four types of lighting to choose from. The rain bath is awesome (so huge, you could call is a rain thunderstorm bath). The glass used for toilet walls are all one way mirrors. They also have choices of DVDs if you cannot find anything exciting to do in Barcelona (which is highly unlikely).

LOCATION

As other reviewers have mentioned, the location is 7 train stations away (approximately 7 to 10 minutes) and the train station is just outside the hotel. There is also the Tourist Buses that take you around different routes right outside the hotel's main entrance. On Sundays (or was in Saturdays - check with the hotel) the funicular train up to one of the peaks overlooking Barcelona runs and this is also located just outside the hotel. 

The neighbourhood the hotel is nice is clean and nice. There are lots of eateries around the hotel that open very early in the morning so you won't starve. If you don't want to stay in the noise around Passag then this is an awesome location. Very convenient, quiet and safe. 

Security at the hotel is tight so you need not worry.

SPA and LOUNGE AREAS

The hotel has a spa and lounge area that is both relaxed and comfortable. Massages are also available. I tried the steam room and pools, which is open 24hours. Wished the steam bath was a little hotter though.

RESTAURANT

Well, they did not earn a michelin star for no reason. They also have an impressive wine list. Do give it a try.

Do consider ABAC as you will not be dissapointed. Barcelona as a whole truly amazing!

Title: Incredible hotel and a fabulos restaurant !
Text: Wonderful hotel!  The dinner was a very special experience ! Congratulations for everything.

Title: Absolutely outstanding
Text:
We chose this hotel because of it's membership of the Small Luxury Hotels group.  The hotel has modern decor, friendly and efficient staff, a cool lounge and a small and excellent Michelin-starred restaurant. 

The breakfasts are fantastic, served by a wonderful lady - Pila(?) of Pamplona is one of those true gems that you can strike in a small hotel - and we unreservedly recommend the lightly poached egg on a base of cheese, bread crumb and potato gratin.  Coffee was served without request and always as preferred - another sign of a great hotel and staff.

The ABaC is not perfect - not enough towels in the room, the lounge / bar was a bit disorganized, the spa is just average and the room shower and toilet are a bit too trendy / gloomy.  That said, this is one of the best small hotel experiences we have had.

ABaC is located slightly out of town, although don't let this put you off - the tourist bus and Metro leave from right outside the gated walls of the hotel.  Despite the busy roads surrounding the hotel, the rooms are brillliantly quiet due to good double glazing and the ultra modern appliances (B&O tv and Nespresso machine) really suit the decor.  The rain-shower is a nice touch in the bathroom.  

Dinner in the hotel was excellent - not cheap of course, although not ridiculous - a must do experience.  We left the wine selections to the sommelier and he produced some great and unusual wines by the glass.

Overall the ABaC is well worth experiencing.  Don't choose if it you prefer cheap, large and impersonal hotels - this is one for those seeking luxury, personal attention, great food and wine - and realistic enough to know that perfection does not come along very often.

Title: Not a five and not memorable
Text:
ABAC hotel has a very nice property and restaurant going for it, but as it happens so many times with hotels these days, it fails to give a 5 stars experiences or a true boutique experience. 

To start with the more positive side of ABAC, i can tell you that it is a pretty property, and it really feels exclusive due to it having only 15 rooms and a very posh restaurant. We had 2 rooms and they were both beautiful and comfortable. The breakfast was very very good. It is served every morning by the same non English speaker lady, but she is so nice and attentive it doesnt really matter.

We had dinner at the restaurant one evening to celebrate my birthday and the tasting meal was excellent and very creative and the service was also excellent, as it should be for a EUR150 per person meal, not including alcohol.

For the less positive side, The showers in both our rooms had a far from good water pressure and they have a design error that makes the water leak from the shower inside the bathroom. 

They don't have a policy of a bell boy in the entrance.  When you arrive - no one is there to welcome you and to help with your bags / shopping bags.

The location is not central at all and you need a 10 min taxi drive to go to or back to the hotel.

But to top it all, were these two service related incidents that really showed me the true colors of this hotel and  its dissapointing service. The hotel did not acknoledge that it was my birthday in any way  and did nothing at all to make this special day memorable for me. Our party had two rooms booked for 3 nights each, we spent over a EUR1000 at the restaurant and nothing at all. 

And when i checked in i asked the lady to charge a different card then the one i made the reservation with. She took the new card number and assured me it was done. Of course at check out i found out that this was not done and that the wrong card was charged. This took way too much time - and attitude - to correct.  The dealing with Marien the hotel manager was not pleasant, and she didn't take responsibility for  their error.

So this is not a true class act.  Next time i'll try the new and amazingly-looking Mandarin Oriental Barcelona.

Title: Great, quiet
Text: Wonderful small hotel off the beaten track.  A Greta refuge from the masses and mobs in central Barcelona. We just returned and loved it.  The dinner was magical! The hosts were wonderful. It's refreshing to order ice and have it delivered in minutes. Free wi-fi also.  About a 10 minute ride to central Barcelona.  I would go back.

Title: Great place wonderfull view
Text:
This is a very nice hotel, the kitchen is open so you can walk through it,
we didn't eat there as the res is closed sun mon
the location is a 10m drive from major atractions.
reception was very helpfull and pointed great places to eat as
bar mut .

Title: First class stylish hotel
Text:
Took my wife here for her birthday and we stayed in the fantastic penthouse suite which came complete with it's own private terrace overlooking the mountains and outdoor jacuzzi.
Staff are excellent and we were welcomed in from the heat of Barcelona with a glass of Cava whilst we checked in. We were given a full and detailed tour of the hotel and it's facilities as well as getting help booking tickets for the sagrada familia and printing our boarding passes.
We ate in the restaurant on the first night which is a great experience and the service was faultless. 
One good tip is to sign up to the small luxury hotels of the world club (this is free) and then book the hotel room through there as you get free breakfast every morning with the membership. Ours was brought to our terrace complete with table linen and everything we needed.
Taxis are surprisingly reasonable in Barca and the trip to the airport is â‚¬25 (although beware the hotel's transfer service is around â‚¬80 as it's limousine service).
Rooms have iPads and B&O TVs but it would be nice if they could include an iPod dock or AppleTV to allow music and films to be played through the system.
Mini-bar is predictably expensive and as has been commented previously, the room service menu is abysmal for a hotel of this standard. We used it once - had two chicken burgers which arrived with no bun and were of the quality you would expect from a Lidl freezer cabinet. Still, none of this is enough to detract from what is a fantastic hotel.
Park Guell is a 20min walk, the old tram stops right outside to go to Mt Tibidabo and the Av Tibidabo metro station is right opposite and takes 15mins into the centre of town (although it only runs every 15mins or so)

Title: modern,perfect and my tip for barca!
Text:
we got here late 28th august
..you walkt trought the restaurant kitchen that is spottless!!
what a wiev (one can walk in trough different entrances)   ;)
hotel is about 10 min from the center, very nice staff
excelent concierge and a great guide for the night life 

our room  (812) is beautifull..maybe its the only room with a terrace ..we love it and we enjoy every moment of it.. had some great sleep-- very quite area..

doors are fun as it looks like each room is a safe itself (heavy safety doors)
all that is offered works 
service perfect, helpfull people

food is healthy tasty..so room service works well
we are looking forward to the restaurant that we reserved for thusday..
and we will post all about it!
spa is lovely and the massages were mmmmmmmmmm

we looove it

Title: Perfect for us
Text:
My wife and I stayed 7 nights at the ABaC and loved it. We stayed in the standard room, which felt better than standard. 

The location is away from the hustle and bustle of the central city, but only an 8 minute metro ride way. The trains come every 6-7 minutes or so. There is a tourist bus stop right outside the hotel. The Plaza Kennedy neighborhood is nice to walk around. We found a local pizza/tapas that we couldn't resist going back to multiple times.

The hotel has a very intimate feel. The breakfast is great and served by a lovely lady. The staff were very helpful. Marien in particular was great. They happily arranged tickets to the theatre and La Sagrada Familia - and gave us some great tips along the way.

Title: "Sublime"
Text:
Having experienced four nights at the ABaC, being looked after by Marien and her team, we would not consider staying anywhere else on our return to Barcelona. 

The tasting menu exceeded all expectations as did the whole experience of this unique establishment. 

Faultless!

Title: Nice modern hotel, little out of the centre
Text:
We stayed in one of the standard rooms, it was gorgeous so id love to see the more expensive rooms. Very modern, had a huge walk in shower and jacuzzi bath in room. We were met with a cocktail and shown around the hotel which is a nice change to being herded in to check in. The spa area was really nice too.
The restaurant was expensive (as expected) and all night of a job (lots of little dishes & matching of wines etc), nice for a treat but wouldnt want to do it every night as it took hours. Food was good.

The hotel is a bit out of the way from the centre but there is a tourist bus stop outside, worth getting the hop on/off tourist bus. There isnt much around there in the way of other restaurants or bars which is what we like, however there is a little cafe type place across the road which sells beer, cocktails, snacks etc

Loved the hotel - My only complaint would be we wanted drinks in the bar area and waited for ages but no one came to serve (it wasnt manned) & wasnt keen on having to keep walking through the kitchen area to get out, although there was nothing wrong with the kitchen, feels a bit strange keep walking through a hectic busy kitchen.

Title: Intimate. Luxurious. 1st Class Michelin starred Restaurant.
Text: Small hotel. North of main city. Easy access via metro 100m away from hotel. Quiet residential area. Interesting building. Stayed 3 nights in a suite at 30% of quoted "rack rate"... Would not have paid the full price! Very luxurious and comfortable room; air conditioned etc. Quirky design works most of the time. Calming environment. Superb restaurant. Well worth considering but not cheap.!

Title: Magnificient small luxury hotel
Text:
We stayed at Abac for a long weekend, and we were very fortunate to be upgraded to a suite room. 
The room was more than fantastic, very modern, very fashionable, all-white, with an understated luxury all around. The best thing, by far, is the bed. Absolutely unforgetteable. 
Breakfast is also very special, with all sorts of different possbilities, all very personalized. Abolutely brilliant.
Couple of not-so-possitive comments: entrance to the rooms is made through the kitchen, not a good idea for a 5star hotel (even if different from any other hotel, but...). The other thing is that the hotel is far away from the city center, which is good for relax but it takes some long trip in a taxi to get into downtown.

Title: Lovely, intimate boutique hotel and fantastic restaurant
Text:
Loved:  Stayed for my honeymoon for 2 nights. Service was fantastic, felt very welcomed from the start to the end, the romantic getaway package came with a rose petal drawn bath with a bottle of  cava, Michelin restaurant was fabulous (I took a picture of each dish) and i was pleasantly surprised by the presentation of each dish.  Definitely worth the splurge.   A stone's throw from the train station and yet in a nice quiet spot (good neighbourhood - no safety concerns even when we came back past 11pm), tram to Tibidablo is just the street next the hotel.  Do spend sometime in the spa area for some R&R (steam bath and jacuzzi).  Quality furnishing and bright room when blinds are drawn up.   Luxurious Hermes toiletries (they are not stingy with providing).  Beautiful bath and separate shower area. Definitely recommend 

Dislikes: None.

Title: Great Hotel with a Great Restaurant
Text:
The service is unbelievable, the rooms large and confortable. We had a great time.

Note: It's not far from the touristic areas, but you have to get a transportation to get there.

Title: Great 5 star hotel with the 3 star service!
Text:
I was in my anniversary when I spent a night in ABAC. The restaurant was closed (as it was Sunday). So we wanted to go to a romantic restaurant. I asked the concierge to get us a booking in a Michelin star restaurant, they got me in the worst restaurants in Barcelona (thanks to my knowledge of the city's restaurants). so we decided to order room service. The menu was too limited to 10-15 dishes and when i called to order they ran out of food, so I only had 2 choices! 
summary, the rooms are great but the service sucks!

Title: Beautiful, Luxurious Hotel
Text: Our room at the ABaC was spectacular. The design was gorgeous, the bed linens incredible and the shower was fabulous. The room also had a lovely window seat that could be enclosed by curtains and looked out into the garden. The room was incredibly quiet and we looked out on a wall of green (we were concerned when we arrived because the street is quite busy). It was like having our own private apartment in Barcelona. The staff was wonderful and recommended fabulous restaurants and tapas bars. Our only issue was that it is a bit far from the Gothic quarter--we would have liked to be in walking distance.

Title: Luxury 5* deluxe retreat in Barcelona
Text:
The ABaC Hotel is an oasis of luxury, calm, hospitality and perfection in one of the prettiest areas of Barcelona. An incredible and beautiful hotel that delivers on every level. We were met by a team of staff that are there to meet every one of your needs and more...nothing is too much trouble for Maria and her staff. We stayed in the penthouse suite with an outdoor hot-tub overlooking Mount Tibidabo. What an absolutely beautiful and romantic setting. We had this room booked for half our stay and to make it even more perfect, Maria offered us an upgrade to this room as it was simply available for the rest of our visit. You feel simply relaxed and spoilt here. After a day of shopping, sight-seeing, eating and drinking there is a tranquil thermal spa to return to and unwind at no extra cost...you feel a million miles from the hustle of the city. The hotel, rooms and bathrooms are a design success and part of the city's architectural genius.

The Michelin starred restaurant at the ABaC was a master piece and definitely worth a visit if staying here or not. Some of the best food we have experienced and reminiscent of Ramsays Royal Hospital Road in London.

If looking for a luxury hotel... the ABaC is a must!!

Title: Absolutely Wonderful!
Text:
We stayed at ABaC for 4 nights in March 2011 and had an amazing experience.  We booked the hotel based upon the fabulous reviews that we read here on TripAdvisor.com and were not disappointed.  We appreciated that the hotel was conveniently located to the metro and bus lines, making sight-seeing very easy!  We also appreciated that the hotel was outside the busy city center and we did not have to contend with the busy city traffic and noise -- yet found restaurants, transporation and markets within easy walking distance.

We booked our Penthouse Suite room through SLH.com and were able to take advantage of a off-peak rate + a 4th night free.  Our accomodation surpassed all of our expectations and the staff of the ABaC was absolutely excellent!!!!  We thoroughly enjoyed every moment of our stay -- from the comfortable king size bed, to the lovely roof-top deck and jaccuzi, as well as the sun-deck chairs, outdoor table/chairs, waterfall shower and spa tub.  We also enjoyed a room service meal -- delivered promptly to our room for our enjoyment on the roof-top deck/patio by moonlight.  Our only regret, was that we had not allowed more days to stay at the ABaC and enjoy the spa + roof-top breakfast.  The staff made wonderful recommendations for dinner, like Dos Palillos, and were able to book events, such as a Spanish Guitar concert, with ease.  We also enjoyed dinner in the ABaC restaurant on our final night of our stay -- which exceeded all of our expectations and was a wonderful gastronomic experience ... service, food and wine were all absolutely fabulous!!  Thank you ABaC for making our stay in Barcelona one that we will never forget.  We hope to return in the very near future!!

Title: Beautiful little boutique hotel with an amazing restaurant
Text: My wife and I stayed here for one night in May. What an amazing experience! Quirky layout in two buildings which makes sense when explained it used to be the US embassy and ambassadors residence and that they are linked through the basement. Room very high tech. and functional. The very best pillows that I have ever encountered. But all this is just a bonus, the real reason to visit the Abac is the amazing restaurant. Words cannot describe the experience.

Title: Did not want to leave
Text: My husband and I stayed here for one night and had dinner at the restaurant. We could not fault one thing during our stay.  The staff were friendly and helpful, and make you feel like the hotel's your own home. The rooms are lovely and the bed is just wonderful.  The food was just fantastic (we had the taster menu) and the wine that was recommended to us was also very good. I would most definitely return to ABaC.

Title: Will keep coming back!
Text:
My fiance and I love this hotel.  This past February was our second visit to the hotel in two years, and it will definitely not be our last.  The rooms are great - spacious with great contemporary bathrooms - and the beds are glorious!  

The staff is fabulous - friendly and helpful.  

The restaurant on the first floor is terrific.   We have tried it under both of its chefs and have enjoyed it both times.  The location is great, because after your meal you will be so stuffed, you will not want to do anything but take the elevator to your room to revel in your experience.

Best room in the hotel is the attic room.  The room itself is not huge, but the outside deck overlooking the city with a table for intimate meals and the hot tub for late night lounging is absolutely romantic!  The room is the one pictured in most of their promos and it is even better in person.

Title: Fantastic Honeymoon
Text: We stayed at ABaC the past week.  I can't say enough about how great it is.  The overall feel is very welcoming but intimate.  It's in a residential part of the city, but there are enough cafes around to find a bite to eat and a great cup of coffee!  Also, the metro stop is literally steps away.  The ride to La Rambla is ~7 minutes.  We rode it multiple times per day.   The hotel is a great retreat from the action downtown.  The staff is amazing from the front desk to the cleaning crew - very wonderful people.  We couldn't have found a better place for our honeymoon!

Title: Beautiful hotel, wonderful staff and amazing food
Text:
We stayed at the hotel ABaC for our honeymoon. 4 nights of pure bliss, the rooms were gorgeous, stylishly designed with your extreme comfort in mind. The Hermes products in the bathroom were a lovely bonus.

The hotel felt like a perfect haven, set a little way back from the chaotic touristy center of Barca in Av. Tibidabo which is a refined suburb with wide leafy streets and gorgeous townhouses. 

The restaurant is beyond fantastic, 2 michelin stars are well deserved. Though for me the best thing about the hotel was the wonderful staff who were charming, considerate, never intrusive and supremely helpful. I can't recommend this place enough.

Title: We'll be back
Text:
ABaC is by far the best hotel we've ever stayed in, by some margin.  The location is perfect, the quiet leafy suburbs of barcelona.  The staff are lovely, attentive but discrete, nothing was ever a problem.  The food was amazing, one of the best meals we've ever had at the restaurants, and the breakfasts, as well as the incidental meals will b e talked about for many more years.  The rooms are very well designed, refined, simple and elegant, they are not like bog standard hotel rooms; small and boxy, but light, airy and spacious. If you can afford to stay here, then you definitely should.  We imagined it's what life would be like if you're Richard Branson.

The hotel smells lovely, which is a minor point, but something worth mentioning.

By our third day, we'd decided that it wasn't just the best hotel in Barcelona, it's probably the best place in the world.

Title: You want to move in!!
Text:
I stayed in this beautiful hotel for 4 x nights. I travel about 50% throughout the year, so I've stayed in lots of hotel. ABAc is one of the best. The service is excellent, the quality, colour of the furniture so warm and welcoming. In most hotels, you know you are passing by, at ABAc, you want to move in, I didn't want to leave this place. The breakfast very tasty, the spa wonderful, and I didn't really see other guests, so it's very intimate and relaxing. Not far at all from the centre, about 7 mins by metro who is just across the hotel. I want to say thanks to all the staff that truly made this stay memorable and will definitely be back. 
So do not look further, this is the boutique hotel you want to stay in or Move in!!!!!

Title: Simply AMAZING!
Text:
I can not say enough about this particular hotel.  Having been to many 5 star hotels, ABAC may in fact be my one of my highest rated.  The premises is an old embassy converted to a hotel space.  There was no detail skipped in terms of design...very zen and sophisticated.  The service was BAR none!!  We felt royalty through out our stay.  The rooms are well appointed and the layout is perfect.  I felt like we were in our own very little BCN apt.  It is very ergonomic in terms the use of the space.  The location is also very convenient as it is right across the street from the train. 

My boyfriend and I were in Barcelona for El Clasico and since I am not a huge fan of massive crowds, I was concerned that we would end up needing a vacation from this vacation.  I was wrong.  The staff and service and accommodations at the ABAC truly made our trip feel luxurious and relaxing as well.

THANK YOU!  Eva at the ABAC was esp amazing! :)  We will be back for sure.

Title: Superb Hotel!!
Text:
We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights and wish it could have been more.  There is almost a Zen like calm in the hotel grounds compared to the bustle of the streets outside. 

I have to say the the service we received was the best in any hotel, ever!!
As the spa was unavailable we were 'compensated' with a room upgrade to a deluxe room and given complimentary breakfast which was a nice touch.  Although we did not eat in the hotel restaurant (michelin star**) it looked excellent.

The hotel is located very near a metro and there is a direct line to the city centre. A taxi takes about 10min but beware the driving standards are very poor and we had a few few near misses + ripped off on fares!!

Title: ABaC just gets so many things right its Perfect!
Text:
What to say...some hotels have a signature feature and the rest is just adequate at best; not ABaC. So few architects are able to apply Le Corbusier design while creating an exquisite space for people to enjoy; whoever designed this hotel was an able individual!

The staff were simply excellent and so professional (especially Pilar) while at the same time friendly and engaging; If possible i would contact Marien Inigo-Schneider the Hotel Manager directly especially if you are going to stay for 5 to 7 days. Get a Chauffeur to and from the Airport arranged by the hotel; some Spanish taxi drivers think they are Alonso...

The Room:
Sound proofed...
Aircon that works effortlessly...
Huge comfortable bed...
Electric remote control curtains...
B&O integrated TV, DVD et al; take some DVD's & CD's to make the most of this when you are chilling out...
Wifi in the rooms as well as throughout the hotel take your iPad...
A bathroom / shower room that is just fantastic...
Lots of storage / hanging space...
Sensible amounts of bottled water in the rooms (still and sparkling); no hotels seem to do this i am still mystified why they don't; how can 5* be 5* if you are thirsty?

Breakfast:
So often i miss breakfast because it finishes "too early" at ABaC you only had to make it down before 11am i made it once and then never missed it. Everyday we finished off our breakfast / brunch having coffee & water on the terrace / garden outside enjoying the sun.

Lunch / Room Service Menu:
Even the room service food was fantastic but i suppose when you think it though the kitchen is run by a 2* chef.

Dinner 2*:
Make sure you book in for two evenings during your stay the first night you arrive (if you are not too tired) & the second last night of your stay. It is a fabulous dinning experience. I recommend Cava - Torre De L'Homenatge 1999 from the wine list.

You now you are dinning somewhere special when you can walk thru the centre of the kitchen during service and it is spotless!

Spa:
A lovely space but Marien was saying she was not happy with it and further work was being planned.

Barcelona:
What a great city lots to do, for me though the Sagrada Familia stole the show. I actually went to see it twice; you can feel the genius. I also tried to get up the huge telecommunication tower designed by Sir Norman Foster overlooking the city but sadly it is restricted access.

We can't wait to go back i may even have my 40th there...

Title: A cozy boutique hotel out of the hustle bustle
Text:
A very nice hotel. Friendly staff, lovely rooms, architecturally interesting, romantic. I liked the location at the north end of the city, near the hiking trails up onto the hillsides above the city, and in a luxury home neighborhood of Barcelona, and yet a quick cab or subway ride into the heart of the city. 

Definitely deserving of the star rating, and very classy. Very small and personal feeling. Modern designs and layout.

I was traveling solo, and found the bar, restaurant, and general activity level to be low in the hotel, so it was hard to meet others. I went to the spa four times and was the only person each time. I never saw others in the bar. So, unlike the other hotel I stayed in during my visit (Villa Emilia), this was better for a private, quiet, romantic visit. Villa Emilia had more action in its restaurant, bar, and rooftop area.

For the price, one might have expected a workout facility attached to the spa (there is none), but there are ten euro workout options not too distant from the hotel. Also, one might have expected a pool. There is an indoor spa, but no actual swimming pool or outdoor pool options.

Title: Standards Slipping
Text:
I chose this hotel due to the good reviews, and the fact my wife is a chef, and we noted its Michelin rating.  This was a special treat for Valentines.  A few items are worth noting, especially as the hotel rates can be as much as 1000 Euros per night.  At this level you expect impeccable service, and faultless attention to detail.  In this instance I have to say it was not perfect.  

The room was very nice, and at the special rate of 300 Euros a night was ok value.  The mini bar prices are very high, 4.50 for a coke!  The hotel did a great welcome job, and showed us everything, but neglected to explain the digital option on the TV that gave even more channels on top of the usual fair of 3 English news channels.  A minor niggle that we didnâ€™t discover until the day we checked out!  

The initial disappointments however came from the restaurant service.  This was a 2 star establishment, but recently lost a star due to the change of Chef.  The service however, was not 2 star.  Several times glasses were not replenished with water until we attracted the attention of the waiter, and once the meal was over we were simply ignored, and despite telling one waiter we were ready to leave, we were left to sit.  Eventually we got up to leave and had to walk to the cloakroom to retrieve a jacket, and only at this point did people come running to help us.  

This is not 5 star hotel, or multi starred Michelin levels, as anyone who eats/stays at this level will agree.  Breakfast on the 2nd day went well down hill.  When we arrived at the breakfast room, there were many uncleared tables, and we chose the only clean table in the room.  After a 10 minute wait we were initially approached for our order.  Eggs were overcooked, and the overall service was very poor, due mainly to the fact they had 1 girl waiting 10 tables.  Several guests had to complain and go in search of the waiter to get tables cleared, and to get their orders I for breakfast.  At this point the reception got involved in clearing dirty dishes.  

Perhaps the hotel may be struggling a bit, hence the cheaper rates, and less than perfect service?

When we checked in, we were told we could keep the room for the whole day on the day of checkout.  When we left for the days exploring on our final day, we again discussed this with reception, and all was OKâ€™d.  However, when we returned we found our access to the hotel had been revoked, and our baggage had been removed from the room rather unceremoniously, and we had to resort to sorting it out in the lobby!  At some insistence the staff member on duty called the manager, who incidentally was the lady who had checked us in and made the offer of the room use on the day of checkout.  She was very apologetic, and did indeed make a 200 Euro refund (about 20%), and provided complimentary tea and coffee, and the use of a room to freshen up.  

Finally, during our stay, we had asked several questions which were diligently noted down by reception, but alas they never got back to us.  

So all in all, some disappointments at this level, and ones that should be addressed by the hotel.  Not  reasons to stay away, but maybe a consideration when picking an expensive room, and if you have high expectations at this level of accomodation and dining.  Guy Savroy it is not!

Title: state of the art, the best shower ever seen!
Text:
staid for 3 nights hotel only.

I used to stay in 5 stars hotel and by all mean I can say this hotel has the best shower/tub ever seen....you would linger for hours under the shower!

everything was perfect apart breakfast that despite being good was nothing of exceptional compared to the hotel.

definetively a win choice if you look for boutique hotel and like quiteness.

Title: Dreaming of Going Back. Absolutely Great Hotel.
Text:
We just returned from a 6 day stay in Barcelona and the Hotel Abac. Previous reviews on Tripadvisor convinced us of our choice, but even then our high expectations were exceeded.
We were greeted by the hotel manager (Marien Inigo Schneider) who, despite our very early arrival (10:30 AM) had our room ready. Very welcome after a long overnight flight. After the checkin Marien gave us a very detailed synopsis of Barcelona which included sights, transportation,museums, shopping and restaurants (earlier she had e-mailed us a list of top restaurants that SHE recommended and then had made reservations for us). All I can say is that Marien is a highly knowledgeable and sophisticated person with impeccable taste. We quickly learned to seek out her advice for anything.
The hotel was modern and beautifully appointed. The rooms were large with abundant drawer and closet space, a large and Extremely Comfortable bed and a huge bathroom. The rooms were cleaned at least twice a day and the chocolate bar on our pillow was a huge plus (excellent),
The hotel restaurant (2 star Michelen) was an excellent choice. The tasting menu was not only delicious but also entertaining (restrained molecular with a leaning towards local foods and respect with Catalan cuisine). The wine list and sommelier were both excellent and the overall service matched he two star rating. However the highlight and most enjoyable moments at Hotel Abac was the breakfast. Abundant (too much actually)  and beautifully prepared and served by the delightful Pilar (who I wanted to kidnap and bring back home with us).  Our only concern was that the hotel was 3 Km. from the center. This turned out to be and advantage as the subway entrance, taxi stand and bus stop were all at the hotel entrance and the center of town less than ten minutes away....even late at night. 
 I, for one, cannot wait to come back to Barcelona and the Hotel Abac. P.S. If you have the opportunity take the train and go to Sant Pol de Mar for lunch at Restaurant Sant Pau. Once in a lifetime experience.

Title: ABaC - wonderful restaurant and hotel
Text:
The ABaC Hotel is one of the best hotels I have stayed in. Fantastic design, clean and modern with friendly staff. The beds were probably the most comfortable we have ever slept on and the children were delighted to find the room came equipped with iPad and the most enormous TV in the world! Our only slight disappointment was we couldn't find anywhere to dock iPod to listen to music in the room. Spa is lovely. Staff very friendly and helpful.

The ABaC Restaurant is quite fantastic. Other people on the site have said that it is stuffy - it is not stuffy in a pompous way but smart as befits a restaurant at these prices and this type of cooking. We had two teenagers with us who absolutely loved it and did not feel over awed.  Wonderful meal - flavours that defy belief - basil sorbet - theatrical smoke filled domes - de-constructed cappuccino -  friendly sommelier too.

Title: Amazing hotel, very peaceful and extremely relaxing
Text:
I visited the Abac hotel for 2 nights and was not disappointed at all. We were greeted by the lovely Maria who made us feel very special. We were upgraded to a deluxe room which was to die for! The beds were so comfortable and the rain shower was truly spectacular. The bedroom felt like no oen else had ever slept there before.
We ate in the hotel on our first night, the food was delicious though a little pricey, however we did get treated very well. This was a fantastic experience and I highly reccommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a peaceful holiday, not in the touristy part like Las Ramblas, and those who want to indulge a little.

Title: What hotels should aspire to
Text:
The personal attention by Maria was unsurpassed in my experience anywhere else in the world. She is the perfect example of what makes this hotel great: dedication to customer satsifaction, and dedication to the hotel itself, since she worked three shifts in a row filling in for a key restaurant person in between her regular duties in the hotel. Only a great hotel can get a professional like her to agree to those hours...

The hotel is beautiful, with every amenity including remotely controlled curtains, rainfall shower heads, a private spa, etc.  

Highly recommended.

Title: What an incredible find: 5* hotel with 2* Michelin restaurant!
Text: Just returned from 4 days in the lap of ABaC luxury! This hotel is truly something else. Just 15 rooms and all of them equipped with topnotch facilities and amenities. A very friendly and personal welcome was just a taste of what was yet to come. The hotel is located about 3 km away from the bustling city center but, that is easily overcome by a short taxi ride or a slightly longer ride by hop-on/hop-off bus that stops right in front of the hotel. The hotel's own parking garage means you can leave your car safely while you are off exploring Barcelona. The building itself is wonderful; lots of wood on the outside and very secure. The inside is a marvel of modern design; lots of glass, granite, marble and stainless steel but, it all fits wonderfully and really comes together. Our Deluxe room was spacious and was equipped with a big Bang & Olufsen tv-set (!). Everything you can possibly think of was in the room and it left absolutely nothing to be desired. The bed was very, very comfortable and the bathroom deserves special mentioning: separate toilet with bidet, jacuzzi bath and a shower coming out of a 40x40 cm shower head in the ceiling. Separated by one-way mirrors from the rest of the room, the overall effect was light, roomy and very, very comfortable. Food at the hotel was truly excellent and it is rightly a 2* Michelin restaurant. Both Ã  la carte as well as the Grand ABaC tasting menu are culinary experiences never to be forgotten: the presentation, combination of flavors and subtle, surprising accents are the mark of a exceptional restaurant and the ABaC Restaurant certainly fits that bill. Staff were very friendly and accommodating and the sommelier came up with some amazing wines to accompany our choice of food. Well done! Breakfast was also amazing: sitting outside in the garden (weather permitting, of course) with so many delicious items served to you at the table. It was also very well presented, made to order and certainly in line with the restaurant. For those seeking a small but very luxurious hotel with excellent dining facilities and truly personal service by amazing staff, you need to look no further.

Title: This is the place to stay in Barcelona
Text:
We truly felt like guests at ABaC - the personal attention and friendliness of the staff were remarkable.  I highly recommend a room with a patio - they are quite spacious and a great way to relax and hear the city.

The area around ABac is residential and a welcome break from the tourist areas south towards the ocean.  Also, Tibidabo is immediatey accessible - run up the hill, follow the trails, and see Barcelona from an amazing vantage point.

I must mention the absolutely wonderful manager - we arrived very early on a Sunday morning, well in advance of our reservation time, worn out from an overnight train ride.  We were greeted by her as friends (!), offered delicious coffee, a tour of the hotel... and swiftly accommodated.  I'm convinced my lingering fondness for Barcelona was significantly shaped by these gestures - this wasn't mere "service" or "hospitality" - it was kindness!

Title: True 5 Star Experience - Fantastic!
Text:
From check-in to check-out this hotel experience was superb.  They truly get what it means to deliver a 5 star experience.  Upon arrival we were welcomed with a champagne cocktail and cold towel - nice touch!  We were made to feel like a valued guest from the moment we entered.  Every employee we encountered was helpful and pleasant.  

We booked the stay via the Infinite Visa Concierge Program and they were fully versed in the upgrades and benefits.  

Our room was absolutely stunning.  Bed was excellent as was the shower facilities.  Hermes toiletries were a nice touch.  

The breakfast, which was included, was outstanding - a real feast and not to be missed.  The spa facilities - also included - were serene and worth the visit.  

The restaurants kitchen is open concept and you can walk through it which is neat to see.  

I wouldn't change a single thing about this hotel or the experience!  We stayed at another boutique style hotel in Barcelona during our trip and it didn't come close to the ABaC experience.  It would be my first pick when I'm next in Barcelona.

Title: Treated like royalty...
Text:
We had previously eaten at the wonderful 2 Michelin Star restaurant and wondered what it would be like to stay at the hotel. Therefore, for my girlfriend's birthday this year, I decided to book 3 nights at the hotel and I managed to reserve the Attic Suite at a not ridiculous price.

The room was sumptious and although not huge, the terrace made up for it with a hot tub, sun loungers, dining table and coffee table & chairs plus, sun all day round.

The service was excellent from the manager to the delightful lady who served us breakfast each morning (she made the table on the terrace each morning as well). They booked restaurants for us at other locations in the city and also arranged the executive cars to pick us up and drop us at the airport.

Breakfast was lovely, the restaurant as usual was superb and the overall ambience of the hotel was relaxed, but you knew that nothing was left to chance. 

I have never stayed at a better hotel and the location is also good, as you are right by a Metro station.

Basically, if you are thinking of treating yourself and want to have a great base to enjoy the delights of Barcelona, try Abac, you won;t be disappointed.

Title: absolutely fantastic!
Text: I had an absolute wonderful stay. The location of the hotel is outside of the busy Barcelona Center, but there is a Metro station right outside the door of the hotel that takes you to the center in less than 10 minutes.  The rooms are large and very comfortable with Hermes toiletries, however the automatic lighting system is a bit confusion. But...what makes this hotel very special is the PERSONAL service from Marianne, Maite and Pilar!!! You feel like staying at a luxurious home. Unfortunately I didn't eat in the restaurant, and since it is fully booked every night, I'm sure I will reserve it well in advance on my next, hopefully soon, stay at ABAC!

Title: Perfect luxury refuge for couples
Text: This is hotel is truly a jewel in between all the other hotels in Barcelona and if I had to choose the best hotel in Europe, ABaC Hotel would definitely be in my Top10. The rooms are spacious and very comfortable and designed for having a quiet sleep- big and tall windows can be covered completely, so that no light disturbs your sleep. The relaxing rainforest shower and Givenchy treats let you indulge even in the bathroom. Spa can be booked per room, which means, that the small pool, sauna/hamam, drinks and snacks are there exclusively for you and your partner. I have never enjoyed a stay more than this one and I am still seeking for a comparable hotel in Europe, that gives you relaxation in the midst of a city's rushed daily routine. Everything can be reached via the near-by metro station, too.

Title: Gorgeous hotel well located away from tourist town
Text:
My fiancee and I just returned from two nights at the Abac Hotel (Sunday/Monday). Sadly the restaurant was closed both nights and the bar didn't seem to be open either - bad timing on our part. We could have tried breakfast but at 30 euros a pop we couldn't quite bring ourselves to, especially with a lovely bustly cafe just across the road at a fraction of the price.
And so to the hotel. We booked a deluxe room which on first sight was disappointing size wise but more than made up for in quirky features. Loved the lighting which was easy to negotiate. loved the electric curtains, loved the two way mirrored bathroom doors, and super loved the wet room complete with jacuzzi bath and huge rain shower.
Also the bed was as comfy as either me or my partner could remember, and the doors are so thick we didn't hear a thing from elsewhere. Throw in huge plasma tv but sadly no dvd player in our room so we made do with spanish tv or the one english channel bbc world.
It's a nice relaxed place to hang out, i was brought coffee on the terrace in the morning, and the location is great if you're not bothered about being on the Ramblas. The train is right there or a taxi to the city is around 10 euros. 
Our only disappointment was finding good places to eat. Sunday night so much closes and the friendly staff weren't exactly full of suggestions. Monday night again it was up to us to come up with something. 
Marian in particular we found incredibly helpful, especially when i couldn't get my laptop to connect to the hotels super fast wireless.
I didn't mention the spa: small, lovely, but the jacuzzi and steam room could have been a lot hotter for me.
Overall, sad we missed out on the restaurant but loved it, and so we should at the price.

Title: Wonderful hotel and amazing restaurant!
Text: My wife and I stayed at ABaC for three nights to celebrate our wedding anniversary.   The location is perfect to explore Barcelona - at the end of a metro line (Tibidabo) with a very frequent service and only 8 minutes from the city centre, yet quiet enough to escape from the bustle of the city, so do not let the fact it is not located in the centre on on the waterfront put you off staying here.  The staff were fantastic and simply couldn't do enough to help us, from making my initial enquiries through to their courteous through to friendly manner in suggesting where we should visit.  The whole atmosphere was warm, freindly, inviting and relaxing - exactly what a good hotel should be.  Our room (junior suite) was not quite as big as I had hoped for, but was stunning in fixtures and fittings, so we were happy!  The hotel layout is a bit quirky, coming from the fact is is set in an old house which has had a wonderful extension added, but the fact you are encouraged to walk through the kitchen says how proud of their food they are and they have every reason to be so!  Unless you have had your taste buds surgically removed you have to eat here if you can - it was sensational and again, the staff went the extra mile when they made a menu just for us on the night due to my wife's dietary requirements; astonishing in a Michelin-starred establishment.  But even breakfast was a treat - fruit salad with basil sorbet just one example of the superb food served here.  Moving on, the bar was an experience in itself and you simply have to ask for one of their gin and tonics - better than any we have had before or since.  The spa was also great - small but lovely.  All in all, we will definitely be going back, as much to visit this hotel as to visit Barcelona, the highest complement I can give in a city with so much to offer.

Title: Great Barcelona hotel with a superb restaurant
Text: This is a superb hotel and restaurant.  All the staff, especially the Manager Marien, were very friendly and helpful.  She quickly realised that food was an important part of our trip and suggested some alternative restaurants to ones we had booked - all were excellent.  Their own restaurant is superb (I am not sure what the reviewer expecting 'more from a 2* Michelin restaurant' was looking for â€“ during our trip to Catalonia we ate in two 3*, two 2â€ and three 1* Michelin restaurants and ABaC definitely stood up there with the 3s & 2s).  The food (tasting menu), service and wine were all excellent.  We had dinner in the garden, which is a little oasis.  Breakfasts were also greatâ€¦and al fresco.  ABaC is a little out of the centre but, I think, better for that.  It is on two open-top bus and the blue tram routes, if you want to be a tourist.  It is also close to a Metro stop and the hotel will order taxis for you.  We stayed in a junior suite, which was very comfortable.  Although ABaC is modern, form does not outweigh function.  Even down to the chocolate bars (by Xaviermor, which unfortunately does not appear to be available in the UK) left on our pillows at night!  We would definitely recommend ABaC to anybody staying in Barcelona.

Title: Discovering ABAC Hotel
Text:
We spent four nights at the ABAC during the December long weekend and I have to say that it was a very pleasant experience. The hotel is an oasis of peace in the upper area of Barcelona; The rooms are spacious, bright and perfectly equipped; breakfast - of the highest quality - is served in the wonderful library, etc.
But the best of all is the great professionalism and kindness of all the staff, attentive to every detail, with that Barcelona courtesy, which pleases but does not invade.
Anyway, we will return as soon as we can.

Title: Fin de semana de lujo
Text: Nos encantÃ³. La habitaciÃ³n era espectacular y la atenciÃ³n del personal exquisita. Nos pareciÃ³ un privilegio el hecho de tener que atravesar la cocina para acceder a la habitaciÃ³n. En un hotel tan vinculado a la gastronomÃ­a es un lujo!!

Title: Una estancia agradable
Text:
La semana pasada hicimos un viaje de cuatro dÃ­as a Barcelona mi marido, mi hijo (bebe de un aÃ±o) y yo. Viajamos mucho a Barcelona porque toda la familia de mi marido es de ahÃ­ y por tanto lo conocemos bien.

No necesitÃ¡bamos estar en el centro turÃ­stico porque no era el plan visitarlo, ademÃ¡s de que la zona es perfecta para poder comunicarse y moverse con facilidad por Barcelona. Tenia bastantes expectativas en el hotel.

La ultima vez que me aloje en Barcelona fue en el MandarÃ­n, pero esta vez queria algo mas "local" y autentico y habÃ­a reservado en tres hoteles para esta visita: (1) Hotel Casa Fuster 5* GL, (2) ABaC Hotel y (3) Hotel Casa Sagnier. Finalmente nos decantamos por este ya que nos apetecÃ­a mucho ver el concepto y la localizaciÃ³n nos atrajo mucho (nuestra familia vive por la zona). AdemÃ¡s, dado que viajamos tanto a Barcelona, querÃ­amos encontrar EL hotel al que recurrir siempre.
Tengo que decir que suelo viajar a hoteles muy buenos, y puede que mi criterio sea algo exigente.

Dejo aquÃ­ mi valoraciÃ³n a cerca de todo:

HOTEL
El hotel es precioso - la verdad es que el edificio es ideal, estÃ¡ muy bien pensado, muy cÃ³modo, muy bien localizado. La recepciÃ³n es muy bonita, la terraza es muy agradable, el parking es cÃ³modo, y en sÃ­ todo estÃ¡ muy bien. Hay dos edificios, uno mÃ¡s antiguo que otro, aunque el antiguo es el mÃ¡s "autÃ©ntico". Nosotros nos alojamos en el antiguo, aunque creo que por eso habÃ­a algÃºn que otro fallo que despuÃ©s redactarÃ©

HABITACIÃ“N
La verdad es que la habitaciÃ³n que escogimos fue la Deluxe (que es la sencilla). Nosotros casi no estamos en el hotel y la verdad es que no nos merecÃ­a la pena haber escogido otra mÃ¡s grande. La habitaciÃ³n en si era muy bonita, muy bien decorada, y el baÃ±o muy bonito y cÃ³modo. La cama era perfecta. Super comoda y super limpia. Hemos dormido genial estos dias.
Sin embargo si que habÃ­a fallos de detalles / fallos que pienso que en un hotel de categorÃ­a 5* GL no deberÃ­an tener:
1. La alfombra estaba manchada - normalmente no me suelo fijar, pero al ir con un bebe que siempre estÃ¡ por el suelo, no me gustaba ver ciertas manchas en la alfombra que te recuerden que otros huÃ©spedes han estado ahÃ­ y han manchado con vete tÃº a saber quÃ©. Me daba sensaciÃ³n de suciedad.
2. Las pareces estaban muy manchadas tambiÃ©n de nuevo son cosas que requieren cuidados, y lÃ³gicamente con tanta gente yendo y viniendo las paredes se ensucian, pero tienes que mantenerlas limpias porque da sensaciÃ³n de poco cuidado - y de nuevo es un hotel 5*GL
3. Las puertas de la habitaciÃ³n - el peor sistema que he visto nunca. Puertas super super pesadas, muy complicadas de abrir, excesivo esfuerzo y nada cÃ³modas

SERVICIOS

TODO EL PERSONAL DEL HOTEL FUE SUPER AMABLE CON NOSOTROS EN TODO MOMENTO Y LAS FACILIDADES QUE NOS DIRON FUERON INCREIBLES. No puedo sacar ninguna pega por nada, porque todo estaba fenomenal, simplemente dos fallos:

1. Nosotros no nos quedamos a comer o cenar en el ABaC porque ya habÃ­amos estado anteriormente, sin embargo si que quisimos uno de los dÃ­as aprovechar y desayunar ahÃ­. El desayuno fueron 27â‚¬ por persona, y la verdad es que no mereciÃ³ nada la pena. AdemÃ¡s de muy lento el servicio, la variedad no es mucha. Les pedÃ­ unos crepes y como no tenÃ­an (ni nutella ni nata tampoco), muy muy amablemente me los hicieron pero tuvieron que buscar la receta... y la verdad es que salieron bastante regular (por no decir malos). Tengo que decir que fueron SUPER amables, pero sorprende que un sitio donde el corazÃ³n del negocio es la cocina, no sepan hacer una crepe en condiciones. Repito, agradezco muchÃ­simo la amabilidad, pero me sorprendiÃ³ mucho. Por lo demÃ¡s el desayuno estuvo muy muy bueno, y las tortillas y huevos espectaculares.

2. Servicio de habitaciones - hubo una de las noches que no nos hicieron la habitaciÃ³n por la noche, y esto si que es algo que me enfadÃ³ bastante porque al ir con un bebe, que la habitaciÃ³n estuviera hecha y perfecta era un gran must. Cuando llegamos no solo no estaba hecha sino que por casualidad pasaba un hombre que nos preguntÃ³ si necesitÃ¡bamos toallas - lo cual tambiÃ©n me sorprendiÃ³ porque nunca habÃ­a tenido que recoger las toallas en la puerta... AdemÃ¡s avisamos de ello pero ni si quiera tuvieron un detalle con nosotros... lo cuÃ¡l sorprende tambiÃ©n, porque cuando pagas 255â‚¬ por noche, esperas que todos los servicios se lleven a cabo, y si no los estÃ¡s cumpliendo al menos tener un detalle con nosotros... porque el servicio de habitaciones es muy importante cuando pagas tanto dinero por una habitaciÃ³n.

LOCALIZACIÃ“N
Esta en la mejor zona de Barcelona, pero solo la apreciarÃ¡s si eres local o conoces mucho la ciudad. No estÃ¡ en el centro turÃ­stico aunque tiene muy buen acceso a todos lados. Si se viene por la experiencia y la cena y todo, la verdad es que es zoma prime y es perfecto.

PERSONAL
Creo que es de las cosas mÃ¡s importantes a destacar aquÃ­. Porque fueron tremendamente encantadores y amables y siempre queriendo hacer sentir comodo al huesped. A mi personalmente me ayudaron en todo momento, y ademÃ¡s fueron encantadores con el bebÃ©, que tambiÃ©n saliÃ³ encantado.

Dicho todo esto, estos son los Ãºnicos fallos que encontrÃ© al hotel, siendo el ultimo el que mÃ¡s me molesto. Pero por lo demÃ¡s tengo que hacer una valoraciÃ³n muy buena porque el hotel es muy muy bonito, el ambiente super agradable, el parking muy cÃ³modo, la zona preciosa, el personal ENCANTADOR.

Sin duda, repetirÃ© y puede que se convierta en mi hotel de referencia de Barcelona cuando tenga que ir.

Title: FantÃ¡stico
Text:
Hemos hecho una escapada mi marido y yo, despuÃ©s de mucho tiempo, esperando encontrar un buen sitio dÃ³nde descansar y disfrutar de una nueva experiencia culinaria.  Pocas veces hacemos reseÃ±as de los sitios a los que vamos, pero en esta ocasiÃ³n no podÃ­amos dejar de hacerlo puesto que tanto la estancia en el hotel como la desgustacion del menÃº superÃ³ nuestras expectativas. Espacio y enclave fantÃ¡stico, y el menÃº toda una obra de arte para los cinco sentidos.
Calidad, familiaridad y profesionalidad hacen que todo resulte perfecto.

Title: Un aniversario de bodas decepcionante
Text: Para cenar, salvo que reserves noche y cena por 800â‚¬, sin plazas. Optamos por dormir con desayuno. HabitaciÃ³n mal ventilada y olor a rancio y el desayuno es a la carta sin opciones dulces, tan solo bollerÃ­a industrial. Fruta de mala calidad.

Title: FantÃ¡stico
Text: FantÃ¡stica experiencia en Hotel Abac. Excelente trato por parte de todo el equipo haciÃ©ndote sentir mimado desde el inicio. El hotel es precioso, con muchas "sorpresas" que no desvelarÃ© para no aguarlas al resto que vaya a ir. Una autÃ©ntica maravilla altamente recomendable.

Title: Felices 40
Text:
Fuimos a celebrar nuestros 40 regalo de nuestros familiares. La experiÃ¨ncia genial desde que entras hasta que sales. La habitaciÃ³n suite estÃ  muy bien. baÃ±o genial. Solo pondria suelo radiante en la zona wc-baÃ±era para evitar el contraste del frio. La cena una experiencia tanto de comida; bebida y compaÃ±ia del personal de sala excepcional. La ubicaciÃ³n de la mesa perfecta. Solo nos ha fallado el spa; poco calor; me han faltado chorros de agua y una tumbona de hidromasaje no funcionaba. Recordad coger gorro piscina pq incluyen albornoz y zapatillas pero el gorro se paga.

En conclusiÃ³n es una experiencia a vivir.

Title: Como en casa
Text:
Disfrutamos de un paquete romÃ¡ntico en una suite del hotel ABaC, que resultÃ³ en que el dÃ­a de nuestra partida se nos saltasen las lÃ¡grimas por tenernos que ir. 

Llegamos un sÃ¡bado y antes de registrarnos ya estaba todo preparado. Gran detalle la invitaciÃ³n a una consumiciÃ³n mientras esperÃ¡bamos en la terraza a que pudieran atendernos en recepciÃ³n. El hotel es muy coqueto, con una ubicaciÃ³n tranquila alejada del centro. El Spa para nosotros solos al haberlo reservado para la maÃ±ana del domingo, perfecto para desconectar del estrÃ©s del dÃ­a a dÃ­a. El personal atento sin agobios, detallista (nos sorprendiÃ³ que mientras saliÃ©ramos a cenar, entrasen a limpiar el baÃ±o despuÃ©s de un romÃ¡ntico baÃ±o con espuma y sales incluido en el paquete contratado.

De cara a la salida, no hubo problema alguno en dejar un equipaje repleto de maletas y retornar a media tarde al hotel donde nos esperaba un taxi amplio para desplazarnos al aeropuerto. Volveremos seguro, a disfrutar de un tranquilo fin de semana. El restaurante, del que solo pudimos visitar las cocinas, merece la pena una mejor planificaciÃ³n que permita poder realizar reserva en Ã©l, algo imposible improvisando las fechas.

Title: Buen hotel
Text: Fuimos a pasar el primer fin de semana de Febrero a Barcelona, y comimos en ABac restaurante y dormimos en ABAc Hotel, una opciÃ³n muy recomendable, desde que entras por la puerta el trato es exquisito, te lo hacen todo muy facil y son muy amables, la habitacion del hotel muy comoda y sobre todo muy silenciosa, cosa que se agradece, nos gusto mucho.

Title: Impresionante
Text: El Hotel es especial, da la impresiÃ³n de una gran mansiÃ³n dentro de una ciudad. Destaca su situaciÃ³n inmejorable en una zona tranquila y residencial lo que le da sensaciÃ³n de privacidad. El personal es muy amable y siempre cumplidores para que no falte de nada durante nuestra estancia. El restaurante no lo hemos visitado en esta ocasiÃ³n pero sÃ­ en otra escapada, recomendable 100%

Title: Excelencia
Text:
Pasamos una noche en la que deseas que no acabe,que dure mÃ¡s y mÃ¡s, las instalaciones acompaÃ±an de modo fluido a la superprofesionalidad  de todo el equipo, como estar en casa... volveremos ASAP.
A.l.f.f.

Title: Inigualable comida, servicio y ambiente
Text: Cena-deseo de hacÃ­a tiempo, que por fin fue realizado. Impecable desde el momento de la entrada al restaurante, recorrido de aromas y paladar, con armonÃ­a de sabores que fluyen ordenadamente, aumentando su intensidad plato tras plato, selecciÃ³n de vino en franca armonÃ­a con la comida. Title: Cuidar un poco mÃ¡s los detalles
Text: Hemos estado 4 dÃ­as en este hotel. En general la experiencia ha sido buena aunque tengo la sensaciÃ³n de que podrÃ­a haber sido magnifica si cuidarÃ¡n mÃ¡s pequeÃ±os detalles. La habitaciÃ³n es muy bonita pero para la categorÃ­a del hotel necesita un repaso; desconchados en los muebles, armario desajustado, griferÃ­a en mal estado. Una noche al volver a la habitaciÃ³n nos encontramos un palo de escoba en el suelo, otro dÃ­a no pusieron alfombra de baÃ±o. Alguna toalla muy desgastada. Title: tolles Hotel
Text:

Title: fin de semana cumpleaÃ±os

Title: Necesita mejorar los detalles y mantenimiento
Text:
Acabo de llegar de pasar una noche en este hotel. No suelo escribir opiniones en caliente, pero aunque ya le he transmitido mi opiniÃ³n a ellos, creo que es necesario hacerlo pÃºblico ya que veo que no soy el Ãºnico que piensa igual. les voy a relatar la experiencia tal como la he sentido desde la reserva hasta la salida.

ReservÃ© el penthouse con unos 5 meses de antelaciÃ³n para celebrar el aniversario de mi pareja. Ya habÃ­amos estado en el restaurante para su aniversario hace 2 aÃ±os y nos encantÃ³ y nos quedamos con las ganas de visitar el hotel.

Al reservar preguntÃ© si tenÃ­an cargador de coche elÃ©ctrico y me respondieron que solo era de tesla. Ellos me pidieron que confirmara la reserva al menos con 48h y que especificara cuando llegarÃ­a.

Les dije que no sabia exactamente cuando llegarÃ­a, pero que confirmarÃ­a unos dÃ­as antes de la visita. Les llamÃ© 3 dÃ­as antes, tal y como pedÃ­an con la intenciÃ³n de confirmar la llegada y todo. La sorpresa fue que me dijeron que yo ya habÃ­a confirmado todo. me sorprendiÃ³ un poco, pero no le di mÃ¡s importancia. les insistÃ­ en el cumpleaÃ±os mis alergias, etc. la sensaciÃ³n de la llamada fue, cuelga rÃ¡pido que ya tenemos toda la info y tenemos mucho trabajo ahora. al menos esa fue mi sensaciÃ³n...pensÃ©... tal vez es algo puntual y que las crÃ­ticas al servicio que lees por aquÃ­ siempre son exageradas...

total que llega el dÃ­a, y vine con otro coche, por lo del cargador elÃ©ctrico, no es un problema hacer eso, pero me sorprendiÃ³ ver que si que tenÃ­an el tÃ­pico cargador para tesla y tambiÃ©n para otros elÃ©ctricos y al comentarlo en recepciÃ³n me dicen que si que tienen esos dos tipos. por lo que ya no empezamos bien...por cierto las plazas ocupadas por una moto y un coche de gasolina...

En el check in nos explican todo, cobran, solventamos dudas y nos acompaÃ±an a la habitaciÃ³n. la verdad que no tengo queja.

ya en la habitaciÃ³n, a pesar de comentar que era el aniversario de mi pareja. No habÃ­a ningÃºn tipo de detalle por parte del hotel. no es algo que exija, pero habiendo estado en varios hoteles de la ciudad del mismo nivel (en teorÃ­a), celebrando aniversarios, cumpleaÃ±os y eventos importantes, siempre han tenido algÃºn tipo de detalle...que te hacen sentir mucho mejor y la verdad, creo que son cosas que no se piden pero se deben hacer en hoteles 5* GL.

En cuanto la habitaciÃ³n, el diseÃ±o, es muy bonito, y tambiÃ©n es muy tranquila. Se nota que tiene cierto tiempo y bastante desgaste. Los muebles y las paredes se notan desgastadas y la ducha como dice una crÃ­tica del diciembre pasado, tienen que arreglarla, ya que los chorros salen por desigual, aunque para mi no es algo grave, pero si lo es, ver que ya se quejaron hace mes y medio y no lo han arreglado. por lo que te da la sensaciÃ³n de dejadez y falta mantenimiento y volviendo a lo de siempre en esta categorÃ­a y siendo un hotel pequeÃ±o estas cosas no deberÃ­an pasar.

en cuanto al restaurante, solo comentar que tuve la misma sensaciÃ³n de descontrol y dejadez en los detalles, y tampoco tuvieron ningÃºn detalle por ser el cumpleaÃ±os. pusieron una vela cuando, al pedir la cuenta, les comentÃ© que no habÃ­an traÃ­do ninguna vela de cumpleaÃ±os. de todas formas en breve harÃ© la crÃ­tica del restaurante y detallarÃ© como fue todo, ya que merece un capitulo aparte.

volviendo a la habitaciÃ³n, la cama es de 2*2m dirÃ­a que es un colchÃ³n de muelles ensacados con un topper. el topper se nota poco mullido por lo que se nota que tiene uso, tal vez deberÃ­an revisarlo, de todas formas el descanso fue excelente y muy tranquilo el hotel, tal vez el mejor punto que tiene.

Pedimos el desayuno en la terraza del hotel. nos lo trajeron con 20 min de retraso y tuvimos que pedir que nos ayudaran a ponerlo en la terraza, cosa que en el check in nos dijeron que se encargaban ellos. como mÃ­nimo tal vez preguntar si lo queremos dentro o fuera no? teniendo en cuenta que estas en el penthouse...detalles...

en cuanto al desayuno en si, a mi me ha gustado, pero sinceramente, hay de mucho mejores. un poco mÃ¡s de variedad tal vez. eso si el carrito que lo han traÃ­do, el mantel muy limpio, pero lo que son las patas de la silla de ruedas se veÃ­an como manchadas de cafÃ© y polvo. muy sucias...mÃ¡s detalles...

en el check out nos volvieron a pedir disculpas por lo de la cena y no nos han cobrado el parking, un detalle, pero el pescado ya estaba vendido por asÃ­ decirlo.

en resumen, por lo que pagas, yo escogerÃ­a otras cosas en Barcelona, con mejor servicio y calidad de habitaciÃ³n. Es una lastima por que el edificio y el diseÃ±o de la habitaciÃ³n muy buena, y ademÃ¡s la comida de Jordi Cruz excelente, pero si no cuidan los detalles, todo esto queda en agua de borraja y la experiencia pierde mucho. Le pongo 3 estrellas por que no todo es malo, pero he salido muy disgustado, sobretodo por lo que pasÃ³ en el restaurante.

Title: EXCELENTE HABITACION
Text: Excelente hotel, solo aconsejable si vas a cenar en el restaurante. Combina diseÃ±o y funcionalidad. Todo cuidado al mÃ­nimo detalle. Lo mas gustito por su tamaÃ±o es el spa. El desayuno una maravilla, todavÃ­a recuerdo el huevo pochÃ©.

Title: La atenciÃ³n al cliente es pÃ©sima.
Text:
Nos alojamos dos dÃ­as y al llegar, tuvimos que esperar mÃ¡s de 20 minutos para ser atendidos, solo una persona en recepciÃ³n y no precisamente muy agradable. 
Las plazas de aparcamiento no estÃ¡n reservadas a pesar de alojarte, y si tienes la mala suerte de llegar en un dÃ­a dÃ³nde el restaurante sirve cena/comida, no consigues aparcar a pesar de haber pagado tu reserva de parking, esto estÃ¡ muy mal organizado, asÃ­ que, un toque de atenciÃ³n. En general las instalaciones son buenas, aunque reconozco que esperaba mÃ¡s. El desayuno es muy amplio y muy bueno.

Title: Luces y sombras
Text:
En general tuvimos una estadÃ­a muy buena en ABaC. Sin embargo, en comparaciÃ³n a otros hoteles, por ejemplo Atrio y Akelarre, ABaC simplemente no se encuentra en la misma liga por el momento. Se puede ver un poco que ABaC no es un hotel privado, donde el manager/chef es el propietario, y como en muchos espacios similares, sin duda se beneficiarÃ¡ de una presencia mÃ¡s frecuente del manager. Son cosas pequeÃ±as que hacen la diferencia entre un hotel verdaderamente de 5 estrellas, y, por lo menos por el moment, el ABaC:

- la recepciÃ³n pueda ser mÃ¡s acogedor y caliente. El espacio presente no invita mucho a entrar. Si, es un problema de espacio, pero indica que la prioridad esta en el restaurante, y el hotel solo se queda como adiciÃ³n

- No es cosa mayor, pero estÃ¡ un poco incomodo de pasar cada vez por la cocina cuando se quiere ir o venir de la algunas habitaciones. 

- las habitaciones muy bonitas y suficientemente amplias. La terraza del penthouse especular. El internet fantÃ¡stico, la tecnologÃ­a excelente. Sin embargo, por lo menos en el penthouse si se necesitan unos arreglos. Lo mÃ¡s importante: La ducha estÃ¡ casi no se pudo usar porque la cabeza (de un tamaÃ±o impresionante, eso si) ha perdido unos puntos de salida de agua, y asÃ­ el agua chorreaba en media docena de lugares muy fuerte, y en el resto muy poco. Este significa que la temperatura tambiÃ©n estaba muy desigual. De veras fue mucho mejor la ducha afuera cerca del whirlpool. El area de baÃ±o en general bonito, pero no muy funcional, dado que la parte mas amplia del mesÃ³n de lavamanos es - el lavamanos, y no hay mucho espacio para dejar cosas.

- Solo se entregaba una botella de agua al inicio de una estadÃ­a de 3 dÃ­as. SÃ­, habÃ­a por supuesto agua en el minibar, pero seÃ±ores, dando a los huÃ©spedes un pco de agua gratuita cada dÃ­a no cuesta nada, y da una impresiÃ³n mucho mejor.

- Lo peor: El desayuno. Sin ninguna duda de una calidad muy inferior en comparaciÃ³n a otros hoteles de esta categorÃ­a. Yoghurts industriales como elecciÃ³n y bollerÃ­a y pan con apariencia industrial?? Un bowl de frutas sin mucho sabor? En un hotel con restaurante de 3 estrellas Michelin? Serio??? EsperÃ¡bamos una calidad mucho mejor del desayuno.

- el equipo muy bueno y amable. Sin embargo, se tiene la impresiÃ³n que falta personal en el hotel. Por fin - tienen 15 habitaciones y asÃ­ pocos huÃ©spedes. QuÃ© difÃ­cil serÃ¡ de ver el manager de vez en cuando en la recepciÃ³n para saludar a los huÃ©spedes? AsÃ­ la estadÃ­a se se sentirÃ¡ mucho mÃ¡s personalizada.

De modo cÃ³mo se encuentra el hotel ABaC por el momento, definitivo hay lugares mejores para quedarse en Barcelona. Si queremos comer en el Restaurante ABaC en el futuro, sin duda buscaremos otro lugar para quedarnos.

Title: DifÃ­cil mejorar....
Text:
He estado un fin de semana con mi mujer, decidimos ir al ABaC y probar, he de decir, que desde que entramos por la puerta, ha sido increÃ­ble!, el trato de Cristina en recepciÃ³n y de sus compaÃ±eros, es magnÃ­fico, te hacen sentirte como en casa desde el minuto 1, no ponen una mala cara, no existen los problemas, te ayudan en todo lo que necesites, vamos, inmejorable.
La habitaciÃ³n es amplia y con todo lo necesario y mÃ¡s, tv enorme y con todos los canales de ahora, hidromasaje, ducha enorme, cama alta y muy cÃ³moda, servicio de habitaciones fuera de lo comÃºn....
Tiene un spa que no es muy grande pero es acogedor y completo, ademÃ¡s de tranquilo.
En fin, un hotel que es verdad que no es barato, pero es de ensueÃ±o....., y si visitas ya el restaurante, alucinas en colores!!!!
Nosotros cenamos y elegimos el menÃº vanguardia, simplemente espectacular, la comida y el trato, ademÃ¡s que tuvimos la suerte de ver a Jordi Cruz, que por cierto es muy simpÃ¡tico.

Resumiendo, lo recomiendo 100%, es una escapada perfecta!!!!

Title: Bueno pero muy caro para lo que es
Text:
Hotel de 5 estrellas en la zona alta de Barcelona. El hotel forma parte de un recinto en el que estÃ¡ el conocido restaurante Abac del cocinero Jordi Cruz.

El Hotel, arquitectÃ³nicamente, es complicado. Como curiosidad, es fÃ¡cil acabar en pleno restaurante al intentar llegar a tu habitaciÃ³n.

Las habitaciones son cÃ³modas y espaciosas, y en general el hotel es bueno. Sin embargo, para los servicios que ofrece el hotel, ubicaciÃ³n, etc. el precio es tremendamente ELEVADO. Text: Reservamos el paquete gourmet para nuestro aniversario de boda, a sido una experiencia increÃ­ble, conocemos muchos hoteles de 5 estrellas pero ABAC es sencillamente superior, si buscas experiencias Ãºnicas es el lugar.

Title: Un hotel a la altura del restaurante
Text:
DespuÃ©s de cenar en el restaurante Abac, pasar una noche en el mismo hotel es toda una experiencia y un placer! Las habitaciones son espectaculares! No muy grandes, pero con espacio suficiente y todos los detalles imaginables, a la altura de un 5*. La cama alta y muy cÃ³moda! Y el baÃ±o con ducha y baÃ±era hidromasaje. Con amenities de calidad y detalles que no estÃ¡n en todos los hoteles. La terraza de la habitaciÃ³n tambiÃ©n muy agradable, un pequeÃ±o oasis dentro de Barcelona, dado que hay mucha vegetaciÃ³n y da mucha paz y tranquilidad.
El servicio de habitaciones muy atento, te explican todas las comodidades del hotel. El spa muy relajante y tranquilo. 
El desayuno tambiÃ©n muy rico. QuizÃ¡s la Ãºnica pega es que no fuera de bufet. Uno puede pensar que es un poco vulgar para un hotel de 5*, pero por otro lado cuando encuentras un buen bufet, bien presentado y con productos de calidad (como es el caso), tambiÃ©n es muy apetitoso. Hay una carta con los productos que tienen disponibles para el desayuno y le puedes pedir al camarero todo lo que quieras. 
Una gran combinaciÃ³n, una cena exquisita al restaurante y alojarse una noche en el hotel. El regalo perfecto para cualquier pareja, familia o amigos!

Title: Un hotel a la altura del Restaurante
Text:
El enclave del hotel ya promete mucho...en medio de una de las mejores zonas de Barcelona y dentro de un jardÃ­n que resulta un remanso de paz en medio de la ciudad. 
El hotel estÃ¡ decorado de manera muy zen, transmite mucha paz con sus tonos blancos y crema...yo me he alojado tres veces, dos en suite y otra en suite del Ã¡tico que es sencillamente espectacular, con una terraza muy amplia donde incluso puedes cenar y un jacuzzi gigante donde puedes disfrutar del cielo barcelonÃ©s.  
Las habitaciones cuidan el mÃ¡ximo detalle, con amenities muy completas y los baÃ±os tremendamente originales, con baÃ±era cerrada y ducha incorporada para ducharte o baÃ±arte dentro de la misma estancia a modo de SPA. 
El desayuno es cosa aparte, a la carta y a la altura de un Rte 3 estrellas. 
Antes estaba una seÃ±ora encantadora que se jubilÃ³ hace dos aÃ±os, pero el equipo del hotel es muy profesional y atento, en especial Mateo, siempre pendiente.

Text: L'hotel ha tutti i comfort ed il personale Ã¨ molto attento. La struttura Ã¨ bellissima ed Ã¨ immersa all'interno di un bellissimo giardino molto curato. I l ristorante Ã¨ al top per qualitÃ  e gentilezza.

Title: CUANDO TODO SUPERA TUS EXPECTATIVAS
Text:
